loans.name: Andrica

texts.en:
Andrica sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has helped her business to thrive. She was able to buy materials and raw ingredients needed in making peanut butter business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve more her business if you will let her borrow again an amount of 20,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional raw supplies like peanut, sugar, cooking oil, bottles and sealer and other items for the peanut production. She will also buy additional merchandise of direct selling products that are usually orders of her clients. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Andrica wants to gain more knowledge about business expansion so that she will be able to help support the educational needs of her children. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more ingredients in making peanut butter and also direct selling products to increase her earnings.

loans.name: Naila Kanwal

texts.en:
Naila is 32 years old woman, residing in Multan, Pakistan. She is a mother of three. She has maintained her house hold activities properly. She has been running a beauty salon for the last six years as she is good trained beautician. Due to her efficient and good work, her number of clients increases day by day.

She requires some beauty related products such as facial creams, combs, also furniture items like dressing chairs, mirrors, etc. So Naila through Kiva field partner Brac Pakistan applied for the loan. Brac staff visited her enterprise and issued the loan.

She is very thankful to brac Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics materials for her beauty salon	.

loans.name: Sreynak

texts.en:
Sreynak is an 18-year-old single freshman at a university pursuing Engineering and Architecture. She lives with her family in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. Her father is a construction worker and her mother is a homemaker.

Due to a lack of financial support, Sreynak would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fees from the first to the fourth year. This loan will help her graduate successfully and earn skills to achieve her future goal. In the future, Sreynak is going to find a good job with reasonable salary, and save money to build her own house. If she has, children she wants her children to study to pursue bachelor or master degrees, if she can support it.

loans.use: pay tuition fees from first to the fourth year for a BSc. in Engineering and Architecture. Her father is a construction worker.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica desde hace 22 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, 64, lives in her own home with her husband.

She has worked for 22 years making and selling tortillas. Her business is located in her home and she has a lot of customers. With her earnings she's able to pay some of her household expenses.

She's requesting a loan to buy corn by the quintal and lime powder so she can continue to make tortillas. That way she'll earn more income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal and lime powder.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly was able to continue her store operation through the support of Kiva and its lenders. It has encouraged her to be more diligent in growing her business and is appreciative of your help.

Once again she trusts that you could lend her funds in the amount of Php 15000 to refill her store with more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income for the last ten years. She is hopeful for your positive response as her earnings will help fund her two children's College Education.

She prays for God to prosper her family's spiritual life and materially as well. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores has promptly paid the numerous loans granted to her by Kiva and its lenders. She is forever thankful for their kind heart of lending her funds several times in the past which really helped sustain and grow her store and has started a small "carinderia" which is a local eatery that sells and serves affordable viands for the masses.

To further improve her sales she is requesting funds in the amount of Php 25000 to refill her store with more quantities rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles for her store. It will also be used to pay for meat and veggies to prepare meals at her "carinderia". This means a lot since it is her source of income to sustain her family's basic needs and in sending her children to school.

She prays for God to continue to bless her business and to have her a big eatery someday. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies . 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items, like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles and frozen foods to sell at her store and meat, veggies for her "carinderia" as well.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UNA SEÑORA VIUDA, SUFRE DE INFECCIÓN EN LAS ENCIAS Y PERDIDA DE HUESO AL REDEDOR DE SUS PIEZAS DENTALES LO QUE LE ESTA PROVOCANDO DESPRENDIMIENTO DE ALGUNOS DIENTES. ELLA TRABAJA COMO EMPLEADA DE LIMPIEZA EN UNAS OFICINAS, POR LO QUE SUS RECURSOS NO SON SUFICIENTES PARA SOLVENTAR EL TRATAMIENTO QUE NECESITA, PARA EVITAR LA PERDIDA DE PIEZAS DENTALES.
texts.en: The woman is a widow.  She suffers from a gum infection and bone loss near her teeth, which is causing the loosening of some teeth.  She works as a cleaning employee in some offices, so she doesn't have the resources to pay for the treatment she needs to avoid losing teeth.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment

loans.name: José Valentín

texts.es:
José de 59 años de edad,  estudió  hasta sexto grado en la comunidad donde reside, no pudo seguir debido a problemas que sufrió el país en esa época por la guerra civil, se casó de 20 años de edad y es padre de cuatro hijos de los cuales uno estudia en el nivel básico los otros ya salieron de su bachillerato, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y además elabora hamacas.


José se dedica a los trabajos en el campo, en la siembra de maíz, frijoles, y maicillo, trabaja desde que tenia diez años cuando lo llevaban al campo, sus padres fueron quienes le inculcaron en aprender el oficio, además sabe de albañilería gracias a que anduvo trabajando por muchos años como ayudante de albañil y fue así como aprendió muy bien el oficio,  además su esposa le enseñó a  hacer hamacas de seda y de poliseda, ya tiene quince años desde que practica el oficio de modo que tiene muchas actividades productivas que le permiten salir adelante.


Él necesita el crédito para pagara mano de obra que le ayudará a recolectar la cosecha y pagará el alquiler del terreno.

José sueña con seguir trabajando en la agricultura, la siembra de maíz, frijoles y maicillo, espera que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que puedan ser personas profesionales de bien para la comunidad, además quiere seguir aumentando poco a poco el negocio de las hamacas de seda y de poliseda para generar ingresos económicos para la familia
texts.en:
José, aged 59, studied until the sixth grade in the town where he lives but was unable to continue owing to the civil war. He got married at the age of 20, and has four children, of whom one is at school, while the others have received their high school diploma. His wife is a housekeeper and also makes hammocks.

José works in the fields, sowing corn, beans and millet. He has been doing this since he was ten, and learned from his parents. He also spent many years as a builder's assistant, and learned the trade very well. Also, his wife taught him to make hammocks from silk and polyester, which he has been doing for the last 15 years. As a result, he has a number of skills which allow him to make a living.

He is requesting a loan to pay for labor to help with the harvest, and to be able to pay the rent for his fields.

José dreams of being able to continue working in agriculture and continuing to sow corn, beans and millet. He also hopes that his children will continue studying so that they can become professionals and do good in their community. He would also like to grow the sales of the silk and polyester hammocks, in order to increase the family income.

loans.use: to pay for labor to help with the harvest, and to pay the rent for his fields.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be strong. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high costs.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have more shops within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be rich. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. All previous loans was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn is 32 years old and married with two children. Her two children are still in school, Annalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Annalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, shampoo and other snack foods.

Annalyn has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future Annalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, shampoo and other snack foods

loans.name: Nelly Fabiola

texts.es: Nelly tiene 42 años de edad, es de estado civil casada, su esposo es guardia, tienen 1 hijo, Cristian de 8 años, gracias al esfuerzo de su madre él  está estudiando, ya que con el sueldo de su padre no pueden cubrir con todos los gastos de su hogar, Nelly se dedica a la crianza de pollos, Ella necesita el dinero para comprar mas crías, así podría obtener más ingresos para poder seguir ayudando y cubrir los gastos de alimentación y educación de su hijo.
texts.en: Nelly is 42 years old and married. Her husband is a security guard. They have one son, Cristian, who is 8 years old. Thanks to his mother's effort he is studying, as they cannot cover all of their household expenses with his father's salary. Nelly makes a living by raising chickens. She needs the money to buy more chickens. In this way she will be able to earn more income to be able to keep helping and covering the expenses for her son's food and education.

loans.use: to buy and sell chickens

loans.name: Rosa Nelly

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer visionaria que cada día busca mejorar la calidad de vida de los suyos, por lo que presta sus servicios en una guardería para ganarse la vida desde hace 1 año. Ella tiene 49 años de edad y es madre soltera, Rosa vive junto a su hijo de 18 años de edad al que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo. La vivienda en la que vive Rosa tenía todo el techo deteriorado, con el crédito que solicito anteriormente, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar la otra parte del techo que no logro cambiar con el crédito anterior.
texts.en:
Rosa is a visionary woman. Each day she seeks to improve the quality of life for her family. In order to do so, she has been providing her services at a daycare for one year. She is 49 years old, and she is a single mother. Rosa lives with her 18 year old son, whom she has gotten ahead with great effort.

The house where she lives had a completely damaged roof, which is why she requested the previous loan. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails in order to change the other part of the roof, which she did not manage to change with the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails to change the other part of the roof, which she did not manage to change with the previous loan.

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es: Teresa de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 9 años, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal y posee muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas ya que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Teresa, age 37, lives in her own house with her husband and her son. She has been selling clothes for nine years. Her business is located at the municipal market, and she has a lot of customers. With the earnings that she gets from her sales, she manages to pay for some of the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes wholesale. She will do this in order to be able to continue with her sales because they generate good earnings for her.

loans.use: to buy more clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia is a married woman. She has 2 children. She operates a food café. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Kyon Paing Village

texts.en:
Featured borrower, Aye and her fellow members were helped at covering their daily expenses through from Proximity's previous loan. The whole group are very thankful for the generous help from the Kiva community. Mainly, it freed them from taking other loans with much higher interest rates. Instead of paying higher interest rates, group members were able to reinvest more funds into their duck business, which increased their overall income.

At this upcoming loan, six new members will be added to the group that totals 30 members. Most Kyon Paing members plan to purchase additional ducks for next batch raise. They also intend to invest at their agricultural businesses and purchase pigs for savings.

loans.use: to purchase ducks.  30 villagers will participate in the loan.

loans.name: Artile

texts.en:
As a married parent of eleven children, Artile works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Artile is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy ingredients such as, pork, fish, meat, vegetables, plus additional utensils for her food production business.

Artile has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as, pork, fish, meat, vegetables, plus additional utensils for her food production business.

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en: A local resident living in Tbaung Khmum province, Phal is a mother of six children, three of whom are dependent on her. The main sources of her family’s income are from growing rice and cassava to support her family’s living for ages. To earn supplement income, she has been working for others for a fee to upgrade her lifestyle. Destroying by insects, she couldn’t get high yields and the price of crop is decreasing at the market. She is new with VisionFund to save her business and as the group leader she will manage her loan portion in order to buy fertilizer, seed, and pesticide to increase the crop yield for her family. She hopes to earn more income to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seed and pesticide to improve on her farming in order to get more yields than last year.

location.town: Tbaung Khmum Province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Leofel

texts.en: Leofel is 30 years old single lives in Bagakay, Ozamiz City. Leofel owns and operates a transportation transport service  for many years to earn a living. He had support the family's daily needs with this income aside from farming. while he waits for the cropping and harvesting season, he does transportation services to earn . Recently, he took a new loan to buy spare parts his  motorcycle to commute between his farm and in other village in town. He plans to buy sidecar for his motor for expansion of his business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motor repair.

loans.name: Whatsapp Group

texts.en:
Alia is the featured borrower for Whatsapp Group. She came together with her other group members to take out this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living standards at the same time.

Alia is a 27-year-old married woman who started, three years ago, working in crafts to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of her family. She is very talented and is known for her unique crafts. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary tools and raw materials to increase her production.

Alia is the first lady on the left. With respect to the other group members, Eman is the lady in the middle, and Rania is the first on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools and raw materials to increase her production

loans.name: Joyce Reyna

texts.en:
Farming rice is a common source of income for residents of Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. Joyce Reyna, who is 25 years old, is from this town and she also raises hogs for a living. She is married with three children ages 1, 3, and 5.

Joyce Reyna is struggling to keep her farming business going and so she is asking for a loan to buy feed, fertilizer, piglets and pesticides. Her main goal is to have a higher income out of this business. The additional income will go towards her family's daily consumption and her children's education. In the future, Joyce Reyna hopes to successfully send her children to college until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy feed, fertilizer, piglets and pesticides

loans.name: Mouyou Group

texts.fr: Nawa est mariée mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés, elle est âgée de 50 ans. Elle vend des produits cosmétiques au marcher et cela fait 30 ans qu'elle exerce cette activité. Elle a besoin d'un prêt pour acheter du savon à 70 000 f aussi acheter du parfum à 105 000 f et enfin utiliser le reste  50 000 f comme fonds de roulement. Dans le marché Nawa est la doyenne dans la vente des produits cosmétique ce qui fait marcher son activité en plus de cela elle respecte ses clients et vend ses produits à de bon prix. Après ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire des épargnes, de s'occuper de sa famille et aussi de continuer ses activités. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt une fois et à rembourser aux bonnes dates prévues à ACFIME.
texts.en:
Nawa is the married mother of four children, all provided with education. She is 50 years old and has been selling cosmetic products at the market for thirty years. She has need of a loan to purchase some soaps worth 70,000 francs and also some perfumes worth 105,000 francs. Lastly, the remaining 50,000 francs is to be used as working capital.

At the market, Nawa is the most senior vendor of cosmetics, and this drives her business. In addition, she respects her customers and sells her products at good prices. After her sales, she will have a profit enabling her to save money, take care of her family, and also to continue in business. She has already had a loan once and paid it back to ACFIME as scheduled.

loans.use: to purchase soaps and perfumes

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 19-year-old single young man who started, almost a year ago, selling cooking gas containers to cover his needs and expenses. He also works in transporting students as a second source of income.

Mohammad is a hard worker and ambitious man who is trying hard to develop his business. Today, he is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy new gas containers of bigger sizes to better satisfy his customers' needs.
Mohammad hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and stay capable of improving his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new cooking gas containers of bigger sizes to better satisfy his customers' needs.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila runs an eatery. She sells homemade meals to locals in her place. She is married and has four children. Her oldest child is 13 while the youngest is 3. Cirila resides in the town of Carmen. She has been running an eatery for two years now.


Cirila would like to produce a variety of meals, but right now, she has insufficient funds to make bulk purchases. She would be able to sell affordable meals at a very reasonable price. Cirila wants to purchase meat, seasonings, soft drinks, and vegetables. Thus, her income will improve.

She would like improve her business to become more productive and improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase  meat, seasonings, soft drinks, and vegetables.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
For the past five years, Elvira has engaged in a food vending business. She sells bread, peanut butter and polvoron (a type of heavy, soft and very crumbly Spanish shortbread made of flour, sugar, milk, and nuts).

She is a 44-year-old, married woman and has five children, of whom two are still attending school. Her income mainly goes for food and school expenses.

Elvira has requested a loan to purchase flour, sugar, peanuts and condensed milk. These could help augment her source of income and slowly enable her to settle her obligation.

She is thankful for the funding and is determined to manage it successfully to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, peanuts and condensed milk.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a mother and a wife from Valencia, Bohol. She has four children. Her eldest is 18 and the youngest is 6. Being a mother, she wants to give her children all that they need.

In this part of Bohol, farming vegetables thrives due to vast lands being cultivated by the residents. Beatriz is also relying on the same livelihood. She farms vegetables and raises pigs for an income.

She is asking a loan to buy feed for her hogs and fertilizer for her farm. She hopes to find sustainability in her business so she can pay for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and feed.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 42 years old. She is married with six children.

She has had a dairy farming business for five years. Besides this, she also has a fruits and vegetables selling business, and it has been profitable. She will be using the loan to buy feeds for her dairy cows and hopes this will enable her to get more milk to sell and make more income to pay school fees for her children. She will also use part of the loan amount to buy more supplies of vegetables to sell and hopes this will help her to expand her dairy farm.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her businesses and make more income to educate her children to university level.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her dairy cows in hopes this will enable her to get more milk to sell and make more income to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Bebi

texts.en:
Bebi is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a food café where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals.

Bebi will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful businesswoman. She will use the anticipated profits for home improvement.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Albertine

texts.fr: Albertine est une femme divorcée avec deux enfants à charge qui vit à Tokoin. Albertine est âgée de 40 ans et est une revendeuse de friperies qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend dans les quartiers environnant. Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit, Albertine sollicite ce prêt pour commander des unités d’habits et de robes de friperies en vue de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients afin de gagner des bénéfices et aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Albertine is a divorced woman with two children to support and living in Tokoin. She is 40 years old and a retailer of secondhand clothing, which are supplied once a month from the market. She resells in nearby neighborhoods. In order to have a significant stock of goods and to maximize her profit, Albertine is requesting this loan to order units of clothing and used dresses with the aim of responding to numerous customer expectations and then earning a profit and helping her children with their education.

loans.use: to purchase 73 units of clothing and 75 units of used dresses.

loans.name: Bundibugyo Teachers College

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Locuku. He is the Principal of Bundibugyo Teachers College, a mixed school in the Rural area of Bundibugyo with 450 students. Bundibugyo Teachers College has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Bundibugyo Teachers College will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Locuku ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en: Mwanamkasi is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she cooks fish to sell. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fish. She hopes that in the future she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Akou Emefa

texts.fr: Mère  de cinq enfants, Akou est une femme mariée résidant à Tokoin. Agée de 34 ans, Akou produit des gâteaux faite à base de la farine de blé généralement appelé « Botokoin ».  Akou s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant et à la devanture de son domicile. Akou sollicite ce crédit pour commander des sacs de farine de blé, le bidon d’huile et le sac de sucre en vue d’en fabriquer un grand nombre et de bien revendre puis gagner des bénéfices afin de satisfaire les attentes des clients et pouvoir soutenir son mari à bien prendre en charge les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The mother of five children, Akou is a married woman residing in Tokoin. Aged 34, she produces cakes made from wheat flour generally called “Botokoin”. She gets her supplies twice a month at the market and resells by going all through nearby districts and in front of her home.

Akou is requesting this loan to order sacks of wheat flour, a container of oil, and a bag of sugar with the aim of producing a large number of cakes and doing well in her sales. Then she could earn profits to satisfy customer expectations and to help her husband to meet family needs.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of wheat flour, a container of oil, and a bag of sugar

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea, coffee, and bananas. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in climate.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Phala

texts.en:
Phala, 55, who is a lovely mother of six children, four married, lives in Kang Meas District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. So far, she has been working as a farmer for more than 20 years. She can earn a net profit of USD 10 per day. During this time, Phala has been faced with a financial issue in her family which she still can’t afford.

She decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to open a new garment shop to expand her business and get more income. She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to open a new garment shop

loans.name: Tỉnh

texts.en:
Mr. Tỉnh is 38 years old and he is married. He has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for more than 10 years.

Tỉnh lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. His family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region.

His family has no latrine. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns him is not having a latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Tỉnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Along with his business profit, Tỉnh hopes for his business to do well, for his children to do well in school, and for his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en: Juma is a Kiva borrower. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes, bags. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes, bags. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. he will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes, bags

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
Celeste is 21 years old, with two children. With one child in school, Celeste works very hard to provide for them.

Celeste runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Celeste has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, shampoo, soap, biscuits, junk foods etc.. 

In the future, Celeste would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is 59 years old woman who lives in Multan, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family consists of seven people.

Zubaida has been running her own business of clothes selling for 6 years.She needs to purchase different types of clothes for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial resources she is unable to purchase a new variety of clothes.

Therefore, Zubaida is applying for loan from BRAC Pakistan, so that she can purchase these clothes. She can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.
Zubaida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Nayrakata Saraña Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NAYRAKATA SARAÑA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mary es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de jugo de linaza, tienda de barrio, servicio de transporte, venta de chompas, venta de pasteles, venta de ropa, venta de carne.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mary es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta  de carne de res y pollo; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió inicio hace varios años por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de carne de res por mayor) que adquirirá del matadero municipal de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la foto aparecen nueve integrantes ya que la señora que viste con chamarra de color rojo es hija de la señora Yola, que vino a acompañar a su mamá al desembolso.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nayrakata Saraña will start the first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal Santiago II. It is made up of 8 members and it is lead by a board of directors where Mary is the president. The businesses carried out by the members of the communal bank are diverse, and include selling linseed juice, corner shop, transport service, selling sweaters, selling cakes, selling clothes and selling meat.

The loan requested will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs, and Mary is one of the members. She indicates that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for 8 months. She joined due to her friend's invitation who is a customer of the institution. Currently she has a business selling beef and chicken meat. She explains that she have learned this business some years ago on her own initiative.

The loan that she will request now will be used to increase the capital to buy beef meat in bulk. She will buy it in the local slaughterhouse in El Alto city and later on she will market it in her sales outlet. This way of working allows her to generate income to sustain her family economically, since she is married and has one child.

When being asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health services provided by the institution.

There are nine members in the picture since the lady wearing the red sweater is Yola's daughter. She came to accompany her mother to receive the loan.

loans.use: to buy beef meat in bulk.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is a Kiva borrower. She has 5 children. She describes herself as reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells bananas, oranges, and soft drinks. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more fruits. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits for family needs.

loans.use: to buy more fruits.

loans.name: Akarore Group

texts.fr:
Côme fait partie du groupe  Akarore et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il  a 45 ans et est marié  à Goreth, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 2 à 11 ans, dont 3  étudient.
 
Il fait le commerce de poules, de chèvres et de fruits  depuis  6 ans. 

Il est à son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de  poules et une chèvre de plus,à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait  avoir une boutique alimentaire et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Côme is part of the group Akarore and lives in Bujumbura. He is 45 years old and married to Goreth, a farmer. Together they have four children, aged 2 to 11 years old, of whom three are students.

Côme has been doing commerce in chickens, goats, and fruit for six years.

He is on his 3rd Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to augment his capital and purchase many chickens and a goat to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to have a grocery store and see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase many chickens and a goat to resell to earn more

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah is a married woman. She has 5 children. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, cereals, flour, cooking oil and other items. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more sugar, cereals, flour, cooking oil and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to put up a café.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, cereals, flour, cooking oil and other items.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois enfants, Afi est une femme qui vit  à Baguida. Agée de 39 ans, Afi est une revendeuse  des coussins qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois  au marché et le revend en parcourant dans les quartiers environnant. Afi demande ce crédit pour commander des séries de coussins afin de répondre aux attentes de ses clients et gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour pouvoir aider son marin à supporté les charges quotidiennes de ses enfants et elle-même.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of three children, Afi lives in Baguida. Aged 39, she resells cushions and stocks up once a month, selling her wares by walking around the nearby areas.

Afi is requesting this loan to order some sets of cushions so as to respond to the needs of her clientele and earn a good profit to be able to help her husband with the daily expenses for her children and herself.

loans.use: to buy 10 sets of cushions.

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr: Kokoe est une femme mariée de 34 ans habitant à Baguida. Mère de quatre enfants, Kokoe est une marchande de pagnes qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar au bord de la route et en parcourant dans les quartiers environnant. Pour commander des pièces de pagnes, Kokoe demande ce prêt afin d’acquérir un grand nombre de stock et mieux revendre puis avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire et soutenir sa famille dans certaines charges et permettre aussi une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kokoe is a married woman of 34, living in Baguida. The mother of four children, Kokoe sells African print cloth (pagne). She stocks up once a month at the market and makes her sales alongside the road under a shed roof. She also sells by going on foot through the surrounding neighborhoods.

So as to order some lengths of pagne, Kokoe is requesting this loan, hoping to expand her stock and then sell her goods at a good profit margin. She wants to be able to support her family in certain expenses and permit her children to get a good education.

loans.use: to buy 16 lengths of pagne (African print cloth).

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda owns a bakery. She sells bread and pastries, serving mostly locals and nearby residents.
She is married and has three children, whom one is still attending school. Her husband is a farmer.

She would like to buy more supplies like flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and shortening. These would help boost and improve her earnings. She could be able to sell more varieties of bread.

It enables her to provide for her family's needs and continue expand her business to become more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more supplies like flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and shortening.

loans.name: Vahagn

texts.en:
Vahagn is very thankful for his first Kiva loan and precious support, and hopes for one more profitable deal. Vahagn lives in his native village with his large family. He has 6 children.

Vahagn is a mechanic by profession and for a long time he worked as a shoemaker, but now he is already a very skilled farmer. He has cows, bulls, calves and a lot of piglets on his farm. Vahagn sells a lot of pork from his farm which makes a rather good profit for his family. Vahagn also has a combine of his own which helps him each season to gather a lot of hay for his farm cattle as fodder for it during the winter months.

Now this loan is very urgent for him since he must buy some spare parts for his combine and make it work properly in order to manage to gather all the hay before the snow covers his hayfields.

loans.use: to buy some spare parts for his combine.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.fr: Gérald, 35 ans, est père d’un jeune enfant. Il vit en union libre. Pour prendre soin de sa famille, il revend des produits cosmétiques. Cela fait déjà 5 ans qu’il exerce cette activité. Il cherche un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock. Il espère gagner plus de revenus de l’activité.
texts.en: Gérald is 35 years old and the father of a young child. He lives in a free union. He sells cosmetic products to take care of his family. He has been running his business for five years. He is requesting a micro loan to increase his stocks. He would like to make more income with his business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of toothpaste and bath soap.

loans.name: Jessenia Jacqueline

texts.es: Jessenia tiene 21 años de edad, es de estado civil soltera, ella se encuentra estudiando, y se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo hace dos años. Ella necesita el dinero para invertir en mas productos, así podría obtener más ingresos para poder seguir estudiando y cubrir con sus gastos.
texts.en:
Jessenia tiene 21 años de edad, es de estado civil soltera, ella se encuentra estudiando, y se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo hace dos años. Ella necesita el dinero par
Jessenia, 21, is single. She is studying, and for two years she has done catalog sales. She needs the money to invest in more products, so she can increase her income and be able to continue with her studies and cover her expenses.

loans.use: o invest in more cosmetic products.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie est une femme mariée qui vit à Baguida avec deux enfants à charge. Marie est âgée de 25 ans et  s’active parfaitement  pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Marie est une revendeuse de pagnes qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Marie demande ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagnes en vue de répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients et de bien revendre puis avoir une autonomie financière remarquable  pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Marie is a married woman who lives in Baguida and is raising two children. She is 25 and works diligently to have a good financial situation.

Marie resells African print cloth and restocks once a month at the market, selling at home and by walking through nearby neighborhoods. To reach her goals, Marie is asking for this loan to order some lengths of pagne. She wants to respond favorably to the expectations of her customers and do well at selling so she can have considerable financial autonomy and help her children with their schooling.

loans.use: to buy seven lengths of pagne (African print cloth).

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as responsible. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, soap, flour, rice, soda and other items. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her primary customers are locals.

Jane will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread, soap and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread, soap and other items.

loans.name: Cléante

texts.fr: Cleante est âgée de 57 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère de 3 enfants qui sont régulièrement scolarisés. Elle vend des produits alimentaires. Elle fait une demande de microcrédit pour augmenter son stock de marchandises. Elle souhaite maximiser ses profits en vue d’offrir de meilleures conditions d’études à ses enfants.
texts.en: Cléante is 57 years old. She is divorced and mother of three children who attend school regularly. She sells food products. She is requesting a loan to increase her supplies. She wants to maximize her profits in order to offer her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and gallons of oil

loans.name: Bunana Wa Bunana Group

texts.fr: Propriétaires de champs, Bunana et son épouse Nelly louaient leurs champs aux agriculteurs depuis 1996. Initiés par leurs collegues enseignants et grâce à l'assistance de leurs locataires, ils se sont lancés dans la riziculture. Au cours de l'expérience passée, ils ont réalisé un résultat de six cents dollars hormis les charges d'exploitation qui ont aussi coûté six cents dollars. Il est confiant qu'à travers cette activité appuyée par le crédit PAIDEK, ils pourront mener une bonne vie.
texts.en: The owner of farm fields, Bunana and his wife Nelly have been renting their fields to farmers since 1996. Guided by their teacher colleagues and with the help of their renters, the couple have started off in rice farming. With past experiences, they realized results amounting to $600, aside from operational costs, which also amounted to $600. Bunana is confident that, through this business supported by PAIDEK loans, the couple will be able to have a good life.

loans.use: to pay for weeding, [plotting, tracking], fertilizer, vitamins, and labor.

loans.name: Las Mujeres De Chuitimamit Group

texts.es:
Albina es una joven de 18 años de edad, es soltera con una linda familia con la que vive en una comunidad de San Antonio Palopo.
Albina (la primera del lado derecho en la fotografía) se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica desde hace dos años, gracias a su esfuerzo  y dedicación su familia ha sacado adelante, ella tiene su negocio instalando en el lugar de su domicilio.
Albina con el afán de prestar un mejor servicio  a sus clientes  ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para comprar más productos como hilos de diferentes colores y estilos  y seguir elaborando hermosos atuendos típicos para venderlos en su negocio y aprovechar la demanda de fin de año.
Su gran sueño es tener su propio local de negocio, mejorar los ingresos económicos de su familia.
texts.en:
Albina is 18 years old, single, and lives with her lovely family in a community of San Antonio Palopo.

Albina (the first on the right in the photo) makes a living buying and selling traditional clothing, which she has done for two years. With her effort and dedication she has been able to get her family ahead. She runs her business from her home..

In an effort to provide better service to her customers, Albina has decided to request a loan to buy more products including yarns of different colors and styles so she can continue making beautiful traditional clothes to sell and to take advantage of the year-end demand .

Her dream is to have her own storefront for her business, and to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy yarn of different colors and styles.

loans.name: Marie Helene

texts.fr: Helene a 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle revend des produits alimentaires pour trouver de quoi nourrir sa famille. Elle a plus de 10 ans dans ce domaine. Elle utilise les microcrédits pour augmenter son stock. Cela lui permet d’être toujours en mesure de répondre aux demandes de ses clients.
texts.en: Helene is 51 years old. She is the married mother of two. She sells grocery items to get something for feeding her family. Working in this domain for ten years, she uses micro-loans to augment her inventory. This enables her to be responsive at all times to the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to augment her inventory

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 61-year-old married mother of three. She started,fourteen years ago, selling Brazilian gold accessories to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker and sacrificing mother who is trying her best to improve her family's living conditions despite her limited income.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house by painting it before the winter season, and to buy a washer. She hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and provide her family with decent living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate her house by painting it before the winter season, and to buy a washer.

loans.name: Mouna

texts.en:
Mouna is a 51-year-old, married Palestinian woman. She is a mother of six children, for whom she sacrifices her life to help her husband in replying to their needs.

In 2001, Mouna opened a book and stationery shop. She sells all types of school stationery, like pens, pencils, and paper. She also has a printer, newspapers, books, and much more. She decided on doing her business because she wanted to improve her family's financial situation and she thought that it was needed in her region.

Today, Mouna has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to increase and diversify her merchandise with new items and offers, to better serve her customers, and to pay for her daughter's wedding.

Mouna hopes to further expand and enhance her business in the future to increase her income and continue to be capable of improving her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase and diversify her merchandise with new items and offers and to pay for her daughter's wedding.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is 32 years old and married with two children. Melody earns income through her retail business, selling cosmetic products to supplement her husband's income from working as a driver.

With her generated income, she has successfully repaid her previous loan used in her business. She took a new loan to buy a greater variety of cosmetics to resell in order to gain greater returns. Using her motorcycle, she has been able to sell her stock in the neighboring areas. Melody wants to improve the general living situation of her family in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetic products.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
For Elsie and her husband, Raymundo, the sea is a marvelous source of their family’s livelihood. It provides a lot of benefits to the people in their community in Tigbauan, Iloilo.

Elsie owns a fishing boat and several fishing nets that her husband uses for fishing. She also earns from the sea by selling varieties of fish in the market. Their combined income provides for the usual needs and education of their children.

As Elsie aspires to save more for the future, she dreams to buy another fishing boat that she can rent out to the neighborhood. But it’s a far target yet. As of now, she needs PHP 10,000 for additional volume of fish in different varieties. She hopes to increase her income in this way. It will ensure the continuity of her business even during rainy season.

Elsie dreams of a secured future for her children and happiness for her whole family. She is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and her religion, which she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: as seed money for another fishing boat and for additional volume of fish in different varieties.

loans.name: Pirnazar

texts.en: Pirnazar was born in 1954. He is a kind and responsible man. Pirnazar is married and has a child. His wife is a pensioner. Pirnazar has a higher education. He works in a local school as a teacher. He has a great experience in teaching and knows his job well. He has a small salary which is not enough for providing his family with all the necessary things. He is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy medicines for treatment of his wife because his wife is seriously ill. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment of his wife.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nina is married and has 11 children. She works hard to support her family. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines and earns additional income from fattening pigs.

Nina is requesting her twenty ninth loan from NWTF for 25,000, which she will use to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She hopes to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Edison Javier

texts.es: Edison tiene 24 años de edad, es de estado civil soltero, el es un joven muy responsable con su trabajo, el se dedica desde muy niño a este duro trabajo de arreglar autos. Ya que el tomo la dura responsabilidad de mantener su familia, ya que tuvo una gran pérdida en su hogar, el fallecimiento de su padre, el necesita del dinero para poder comprar un taladro y así poder  seguir adelante con los gastos de su humilde  hogar.
texts.en:
Edison is 24 years old, and he is single. He is a responsible young man with his work. He has earned a living since he was a young boy in the difficult job of fixing cars. Now he has taken the tough responsibility of supporting his family since there was a big loss in his family; his father passed away.

He is requesting a loan to buy a drill, and thus be able to continue on with the expenses of his humble home.

loans.use: to buy tools for his work.

loans.name: Jean Frederick

texts.fr: Frederick a 46 ans. Il vit avec sa femme et leurs trois enfants à Bon Repos. Entrepreneur, il détient une boutique de produits alimentaires à côté de sa maison. Il a déjà bénéficié de plusieurs microcrédits qu’il a injectés dans son activité pour augmenter son chiffre d’affaires. Le dernier prêt reçu lui permet d’augmenter ses stocks.
texts.en: Frederick is 46 years old. He lives with his wife and three children in Bon Repos. Entrepreneur, he owns a food shop next to his house. He has already received several micro loans which he invested in his business to increase its turnover. The last loan he received enables him to increase his inventory.

loans.use: to increase his inventory

loans.name: Hamra Group

texts.en:
Gladice is the featured borrower of Hamra ggroup. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have been friends since they left their hometown in Philippines to come and work in Lebanon, where they can earn a better income to support their beloved ones back in Philippines.

Gladice is a 34-year-old married woman who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her family and improve their living conditions in Philippines, thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her brother's university tuition fees. In the photo, Gladice is the second lady from the right.

With respect to the other group members, Lilia is the first on the right, Ma Elsie is the second from the left, and Estrella is lady on the far left of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her brother's university tuition fees

loans.name: Jijuka Rutete Group

texts.en:
Jeanne d`Arc is the second person holding a book and is the president of Jijuka Rutete Group. She has worked with Vision Finance Company since 2010 to develop her business, and is happy to report that she is a repeat client, which shows her diligence and commitment.

Jeanne d`Arc is a 50-year-old married mother of one child. She has owned and operated an agriculture business selling beans and Irish potatoes for the past 5 years, an enterprise that requires her to work from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day, and still manage her household.

Jeanne d`Arc has requested a Koramuhinzi loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand her agriculture business by cultivating more beans and Irish potatoes to sell. The Koramuhinzi loan product is a pre-harvest loan where the borrower will not be required to pay off the principle until after the harvest. This loan will allow Jeanne d`Arc and her family to maintain their current standard of living until proceeds from the harvest arrive. With the pre-harvest funds, Jeanne d`Arc will be able to pay her children's school fees and provide family support until her crops are ready to sell. She intends to use the profits from her harvest to save for the future, when she will be able to renovate her house; and to buy a cow and a bicycle.

loans.use: to expand her agricultural activities by cultivating more beans and irish potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 53-year-old married mother of four. She opened, five years ago, a grocery shop to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and ambitious woman who has a good reputation among her region. 

Today, Amal is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business through increasing her merchandise with new items and offers to satisfy her customers' needs in the upcoming Christmas season. She hopes to keep on expanding her business to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new items and offers for the Christmas season

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in prices. She will use the loan of 30,000 KES to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. She hopes that in the future she will have increased profits. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man, who has five children. He describes himself to be visionary.

Joseph operates a farm where he grows maize and other crops. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Joseph will use the KES 52,000 loan to buy farm inputs. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved living standards. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

Joseph will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 5 years and her primary customers are locals.

 She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: Martha tiene 46 años de edad, es de estado civil viuda tiene tres hijos, una de ellas es Carlita tiene 8 años  quien estudia gracias a la dedicación y constancia de su madre, Martha se dedica a la venta de repuestos para vehículos por este motivo ella solicita este crédito para poder aumentar su negocio y por ende aumenta sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Martha is 46 old, and is a widow with three children. One of her children is Carlita who is 8 years old and is in school, thanks to the dedication and perseverance of her mother.

Martha makes a living selling spare parts for vehicles, which is why she is requesting a loan so that she can increase her business and thus her profits.

loans.use: to increase her business selling spare parts for vehicles.

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is 48 years old from Zugdidi district. He lives with his parents-in-law.

Gela is unemployed and decided to open a car wash. He needs money to purchase a special apparatus which is used to wash cars well. The startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 900 USD. With the received credit, he will open a car wash and will have a stable income.

Gela is very motivated and awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a car wash and generate a stable income.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 45-year-old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So, she started a business selling cloth.

She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. Shehnaz is famous among her neighbours for her collections and has a good client list.

Currently she needs a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase good-quality cloth of different colours to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colours to earn substantial profits through this investment.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking a long time to pay for goods taken on credit.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is 59 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earns profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life. Shameem aspires to further expand her business and increase the number of animals she owns at present.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earns profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life

loans.name: Marie Suzanne

texts.fr: Suzanne est âgée de 46 ans. Elle vit avec son mari et leurs cinq enfants. Elle a une boutique à domicile. Elle y vend des produits alimentaires et des boissons gazeuses. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter des caisses de lait concentré.
texts.en: Suzanne is 46 years old. She lives with her husband and their five children. She has a shop in her home, where she sells grocery items and fizzy drinks. She is asking for a loan to purchase cases of concentrated milk.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of concentrated milk

loans.name: Tzanjuyu Jaibalito Group

texts.es:
Joaquín es un hombre de 45 años de edad es casado con una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 3 y 19 años, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Joaquín (el primero del lado izquierdo) para sacar adelante a su familia trabaja como jornalero y guía de  turista, con esta actividad lleva 10 años de realizarlo, gracias a su simpatía con las personas trabajo no le hace falta.
Joaquín se ha unido a un grupo de personas porque tiene la necesidad de un préstamo para la compra de materiales como: cemento, cal y arena de construcción para remodelar su casa, pues se encuentra en muy malas condiciones  y lo que él busca es darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Joaquin is a 45-year-old man, he is married and has a beautiful family of four children with ages between 13 and 19 years old. This family lives in the city of Sololá. In order to get his family ahead, Joaquin (the first one on the left) works as a day laborer and a tour guide. He has ten years of experience in this occupation, and thanks to his friendliness with other people, he never lacks work.

Joaquin has joined a group of people because he is in need of a loan to buy construction materials such as cement, lime powder, and sand to remodel his home. He is currently in very poor conditions, and what he wants is to give his family greater stability in their lives.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, lime powder, and sand.

loans.name: Margarethe

texts.fr: Grace à son dernier crédit, Margarethe a augmenté son stock. Cela lui a permis d'accroître légèrement ses ventes. Elle veut avoir un nouveau crédit pour augmenter davantage son stock.
texts.en: Thanks to her first loan, Margarethe has augmented her inventory. This has enabled her to grow her sales somewhat. She wants to have a new loan to augment her inventory further.

loans.use: increase her inventory of food supplies.

loans.name: Nasrin

texts.en: Nasrin is a 43-year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years. She is a mother of 5 children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of her customers efficiently, to get a boost in her earnings, and for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie a 36 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle revend des produits cosmétiques. Cela lui permet de gagner un peu d’argent pour prendre soin de sa famille. Elle utilise les crédits pour augmenter ses stocks et développer l’activité.
texts.en: Marie is 36 years old and the married mother of four. She sells cosmetic products. This enables her to earn a little money to care for her family. She uses loans to increase her stock of merchandise and to develop her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of toothpastes and toothbrushes

loans.name: Latifjon

texts.en:
Latifjon comes from South Tajikistan. He is a young, hardworking man. Latifjon is single and he lives with parents. He is a higher educated man who has worked more than five years in a local school as a teacher. He has good knowledge and his pupils like his classes. He always tries to hold classes according new methods and to give max knowledge to pupils.

Now, he is asking for a loan of 600 TJS from IMON and Kiva lenders, because he must treat his teeth as he suffers from toothache. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to treat his teeth.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a Kiva borrower. She has there children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation of prices.

Fatuma will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock ingredients for preparing food for sale. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful business woman.

loans.use: to buy more stock ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man who has eight children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a bakery where he bakes cakes and bread to sell. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for baking. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Rosemène

texts.fr: Rosemène a 29 ans, elle vit en union libre et elle a trois enfants qui sont scolarisés. Elle vend des vêtements d’occasion depuis trois ans. C’est grâce aux revenus de cette activité qu’elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Elle demande un crédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
Rosemène is 29 years old, lives in a free union and has three children who are in school. She has been selling used clothing for three years.

She supports her family’s needs with the profits from her business. She is requesting a loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothing.

loans.name: Theana

texts.fr: Theana, 44 ans, est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle gère un petit commerce de produits alimentaires divers. Elle revend du sucre, des bonbons, du lait, etc. Elle a besoin d’un microcrédit pour acheter des boites de fromage.
texts.en: Theana, aged 44, is the married mother of three. She manages a small-scale business selling various grocery items. She sells sugar, candies, milk, etc. She has need of a micro-loan to purchase cans of cheese.

loans.use: to purchase cans of cheese

loans.name: Nani

texts.en: Nani is a 38-year-old married woman. She lives in Khobi district with her husband and 4 children. The family lives in poverty. Nina's husband gets invalid pension and her children get social assistance from the government. Nani has 6 cows and produces dairy products and sells them as well as uses them for feeding the family. Nani wants to start a trading business and has requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,000 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of clothes and will start trading them. She is very motivated to generate a stable income and feed her children.

loans.use: to begin trading clothes.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 56-year-old, married woman.

Shamim's husband (also shown in the photo) has been doing a business selling fruits for many years. He manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support his family.

For the improvement of her husband's business, Shamim has contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas to meet market demands consistently.

Shamim is positive about her husband's future earnings.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes, and guavas to meet market demands consistently.

loans.name: Roselande

texts.fr: Roselande a 39 ans. Mère de trois enfants, elle vit en union libre. Elle revend des produits alimentaires au marché public de son quartier. Elle a un stand de marchandises bien garni. Elle cherche un prêt pour acheter des caisses de saumon.
texts.en: Roselande is 39 years old. The mother of three, she lives in a common-law marriage. She sells grocery items at the public market in her neighborhood. She has a a nicely supplied stand of merchandise. She is looking for a loan to purchase cases of salmon.

loans.use: to purchase cases of salmon

loans.name: Sharfan

texts.en:
Day by day increasing expenditures compelled Sharfan to initiate her own business, selling animals. She is a 54-year-old, married woman doing business with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of two children. She is working very hard to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers.

loans.name: Sayahror

texts.en:
Sayahror is 38. He lives with his wife and his two children in the Bohtar district of Tajikistan. His children are 5 and 3 years old. His wife works in farming. Sayahror is a very dynamic and hardworking man who is involved in agriculture, in his own district. He works the land earnestly and agriculture is his only source of income.

This season Sayahror and his wife planted some corn and potatoes. He still needs to enrich his soil with mineral fertilizers, so that he can get a good and plentiful harvest. However, Sayahror doesn't have enough money to buy mineral fertilizers, which is the reason he has decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Being a mother and wife, Mary Jane always desires for comfortable living and a better future for her family. Mary Jane is 33 years old, married and has one kid. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates their farm and grows corn.

With her aspiration to help her husband raise their standard of living, Mary Jane engages in retailing business. She operates a sari-sari store business in their village, and she buys and sells bananas while she is also growing their pineapple fruit crops.

Mary Jane is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy fertilizers for her crops. She will also use her loan to pay for the labor cost of removing unwanted weeds from her fruit crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 48 years old, a widow woman, and a mother of four children. She has been doing the business of tailoring for many years to support her family. She knows very well the techniques of stitching and has become famous in her community. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Now she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, and ribbons and laces for meeting the orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Nasreen hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, and ribbons and laces for meeting the orders on time.

loans.name: Ninel

texts.en:
Ninel is a 41-year-old mother of four children ranging in age from two through twenty-two years of age.

Together with her husband, Ninel has been involved in farming work. They also started a small business, own a flour mill, and provide paid services to their co-villagers.

The family's farm includes cows, oxen, sheep, pigs and hens. Ninel and her husband also cultivate potatoes, wheat, and grow apple and pear trees.

Ninel is asking for this loan to invest in their farm and develop it. She plans to purchase barley seeds, and cover cultivation and harvesting costs to sustain the farming business to gather income for the family.

The support received from Kiva lenders will be very helpful for this hardworking woman and her family.

loans.use: to pay for barley seeds, and cover the cultivation and harvesting costs to sustain the farming business.

loans.name: Seduilise

texts.fr: Seduilise a 41 ans et elle vit en union libre. Elle habite avec son compagnon et leur fils. Elle gère une boutique dans laquelle elle vend des sandales. Elle demande un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock et à l’avenir elle espère améliorer sa situation financière.
texts.en:
Seduilise is 41 and is in a common-law marriage. She lives with her companion and their son. She manages a shop in which she sells sandals.

Seduilise is asking for a small loan to grow her stock; in future, she hopes to improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sandals.

loans.name: Jean Raymond

texts.fr: Jean Raymond a 55 ans, il est marié et il a deux enfants. Il est libraire et il vend des livres depuis près de vingt ans. C’est grâce à cette activité qu’il a pu offrir une éducation à ses enfants et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il demande un microcrédit pour continuer à augmenter son stock et acheter de nouveaux livres.
texts.en: Jean Raymond is 55 years old and married. He has two children. He is a bookseller and has been selling books for nearly twenty years.
