Erlinda resides in the rural town of Pilar. She owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, situated in front of her house. She sells merchandise like cooking oil, bread, biscuits, seasonings, coffee, powdered milk, pouch vinegar, soap, shampoo, eggs, and toiletries.  She is a widowed woman and has three  children, of which one is still attending school.
She needs to stock up her shop to attract potential customers. Unfortunately, she does not have enough funds to make bulk purchases. So, Erlinda joined CEVI to invest in supplies like soft drinks, edible oil, soap, and beverages. 
In that way, she will be able to manage the flow of inventory in her store and be able to handle her finances wisely.  She could start to save and continue to expand to become sustainable.

loans.use: to  invest in supplies like soft drinks, edible oil, soap, and beverages

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane focuses herself into her butcher shop business.She has been in this kind of business for three years. Aside from her butcher business she also has roast pig for sale. She is happily living with her live-in partner. According to her, she supplies rolling vendors and nearby restaurants. She wakes up 2:00 o'clock in the morning to sell. She has been doing this routine everyday to generate income. Jane would like to have continuous development of her business that's the reason why she's seeking for a loan of PHP 50,000. This amount of loan will be use in buying additional pigs to sell. She hopes for approval of her requested loan amount. 

The extra person at the business picture is Jane's helper in her butcher business.

loans.use: to be use in buying pigs for her butcher shop business

loans.name: Sandra Mariela

texts.es: Sandra  tiene 36 años de edad, es de estado civil casada, su esposo es jornalero, tienen tres hijos, Luis de 17 años, Carlos de 15 años y Belén de 9 años de edad, ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de chanchos, en esta actividad ya lleva más de 8 años, esto le permite obtener ganancias para los gastos de su hogar, solicita de este crédito para la compra de más chanchos, así podrá vender más y sus ganancias aumentaran, y así podrá  ayudar con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Sandra is 36 years old and married. Her husband is a day laborer and they have three children: Luis who is 17, Carlos who is 15, and Belén who is 9 years old. Sandra makes a living breeding and selling pigs, which she has done for more than 8 years. This job allows her to obtain an income to pay for household expenses.

Sandra is requesting this loan to buy more pigs, so that she can sell more and increase her profits, which can help with the costs of her home.

loans.use: to buy and sell more pigs.

loans.name: Gasange Group

texts.fr:
Paul fait partie du groupe  Gasange et  habite à  Rumonge. C’est un célibataire de  35 ans.
 
Il fait le  commerce de l’huile de palme  depuis  5 ans. 

Il est à son cinquième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité d’huile de palme à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait  se marier.
texts.en:
Paul is part of the group Gasange and lives in Rumonge. He is 35 years old and unmarried.

Paul has been doing commerce in palm oil for five years.

He is on his 5th Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to augment his capital and purchase a large amount of palm oil to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to get married.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of palm oil to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Julia Luz

texts.es: Julia tiene 54 años de edad, es de estado civil casada, su esposo es chofer, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de papas, es una persona muy responsable y dedicada con su trabajo, Julia solicita el crédito para invertir  en la compra de mas papas, para así poder obtener mayores ganancias al momento de venderlas y  así poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Julia is 54 years old, she is married, and her husband is a driver. She makes a living buying and selling potatoes. She is a very responsible person and dedicated to her job.

Julia is requesting the loan to invest in buying more potatoes to obtain more earnings at the point of selling them, and in this way, to be able to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy and sell potatoes.

loans.name: Parisi Simbasso Group

texts.fr: Femme courageuse Nessenè est celle qui est assise devant avec des tissus sur sa jambe ; âgée de 42 ans, marié et mère de 4 enfants  tous scolarisés. Elle fait le commerce des pagnes et des habits de près à porter  il y a 10 ans de cela,  elle peut réalise un bénéfice de 25000f par mois  grâce a sa clientèle ; Respectant toujours ces échéances de remboursement , elle a besoin des services financiers du RMCR pour augmenter ses achats de pagnes; et satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle enfin de gagner plus d’argent et tirer le maximum de profit de ses ventes dans le bute de payer les frais de scolarités des enfants.
texts.en:
A courageous woman, Nessenè is the one in the photo sitting in front with fabrics on her legs. She is 42 years old and the married mother of four children, all provided with education. For ten years, he has been doing commerce in 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and in ready-to-wear clothing. She may make a profit of 25,000 francs per month, thanks to her customer base.

Always respecting her payment due dates, she has need of financial services from RMCR to increase her purchases of ‘pagne ‘cloth and to satisfy the demands of her customers. She could then earn more money and make the maximum profit from her sales. Her goal is to cover her children’s education costs.

loans.use: to do commerce in 'pagne' cloth and ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Blanca Melva

texts.en:
Blanca Melva is 51 years old. She’s married, but a long time ago her husband abandoned her and her children. She’s the mother of three sons, and two of them are still in school. Melva lives and works in Ibarra, a city located in northern Ecuador. She lives with her sons in her mother’s house. On weekends they help her with the work.

She has a small fruit and vegetable store in the principal city market. Recently her business was affected by the increase of street vendors in the area. This problem has made her average sales decrease. For that reason, she’s decided to work outside the market in the afternoons. She will use the funds to purchase pineapples, papayas, tomatoes and vegetables through a dealer; this allows her to offer better prices.

Melva is a hard worker and hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase pineapples, papayas, tomatoes and vegetables.

loans.name: José Fermín

texts.es:
José de 28 años de edad, es un hombre lleno de deseos de  trabajar y de salir adelante, él vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, ellos viven en una humilde casa pero son muy felices juntos pues agradecen a Dios por lo poco que tienen, los niños están pequeños, uno de 4 años y el otro de 2 años de edad. 


José se dedica a la agricultura y  a la pesca , él se ha dedicado toda su vida a esas dos actividades productivas, él siembra frijoles para el consumo del hogar y la pesca es un ingreso extra ya que ellos comercializan el pescado en el mercado de su pueblo, la pesca es un oficio artesanal de esa zona y José no es la excepción de practicarlo.


Él necesita este crédito para comprar repuestos para la reparación del motor de su lancha, ya que es la herramienta indispensable para llevar a cabo su trabajo.


Los planes de José para un futuro son convertirse en un comerciante exitoso y comprar otra lancha para trabajar y obtener mas ganancias gracias a la pesca, con ello él desea darles a sus hijos y esposa todo lo mejor.
texts.en:
José, aged 28, is a man who is full of desire to work and get ahead. He lives with his spouse and two children. Their home is humble but they are very happy together so they thank God for what they have. His children are young, one is 4 and the other 2 years old.

José works in both agriculture and fishing, both of which he has been doing for his whole life. He grows beans for consumption at home, and fishing is an extra income as he sells his fish in the village market. Fishing is a traditional trade in the area, and José is not unique in working in this profession.

He needs a loan to buy parts to repair the motor for his boat, which is an indispensable tool for carrying out his work.

José's plans for the future are to become a successful trader, and to buy another boat to work and obtain more income from fishing. With this he wishes to give his children and spouse the very best.

loans.use: to buy parts to repair his boat's motor.

loans.name: Romel

texts.en:
Romel is engaged in farming. He has been operating his farming business for five years and earns a monthly net income of 10,000.00 PHP. Romel is 37 years old and married and has two school-aged kids. He is from the village of Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur.

In 2009, Romel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Romel has successfully repaid his previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used for personal purposes. Romel is requesting his eighth loan, this one for 15,000 PHP, which will be used for the expansion of his existing business. He wants to pay for land and seed-bed preparations.

loans.use: to pay for land and seed-bed preparations.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en: Esperanza owns a rice production business in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. Being a microfinance member of PMPC, she diligently pays all her obligations from the earnings of her business. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds that will have good results, resulting in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will produce healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is 63 years old, married, and has children with the oldest attending college. She grows rice, earning approximately 12,000 PHP per month. 
 
Crispina requested a loan from Paglaum MPC, her partner in all her financial needs for her business ventures, for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase rice seeds with healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. With the loan, she will use able to supply the demands of her growing number of customers.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina has owned and operated her ornamental business for more than fifteen years now. She was able to provide for her family and successfully repaid her previous loan used for backyard farming. She also now earns well from her investments.

Josefina wants to improve her ornamental farm for she wants to ensure a better and greener farm. She would like to apply for a new loan, this time amounting to 50,000 PHP, to purchase organic fertilizer to improve the farm.

In the future, Josefina wants to see her farming business thrive for she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

She is consistent in attending the weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members. There she gains spiritual strength from members' life-changing testimonies, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays micro-finance loans, and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers to improve the farm.

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 5 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée en 2009. IL regroupe des femmes habitant presque toutes le même quartier, partageant la même langue et la même culture. Elles entretiennent de bonnes relations et sont très solidaires.
KOUKA assise à l’extrême droite de la photo est l'emprunteuse vedette, elle est veuve, âgée de 48 ans et mère de 2 garçons et une fille. Elle s'active dans le commerce de tissus. Elle achète ses tissus dans une région du pays et les revend dans sa ville.
Avec son nouveau pret, elle compte acheter des tissus pour homme 15 paquets à 14 000 FCFA et des tissus pour femme 7 paquets à 15 000 FCFA le paquet et les revendre dans sa ville. 
Avec les bénéfices, elle compte s'occuper de sa famille d'autant plus qu'elle est veuve depuis des années. Elle compte payer les factures d'eau et assurer la scolarité de ces enfants surtout son cadet.
texts.en:
This group of five members is part of the 'banc villageois' that was created in 2009. The group is composed of women almost all of them living in the same neighborhood and sharing the same language and culture. The women maintain good relationships among themselves and have a lot of solidarity.

KOUKA, sitting at the far right in the photo, is the featured borrower. She is a widow, 48 years old, and the mother of two boys and a girl. She has been active in the commerce of fabrics. She buys her fabrics from a region in the country and resells them in her town.

With her new loan, she intends to purchase some fabrics for men (15 packets worth 14,000 francs CFA) and some fabrics for women (7 packets worth 15,000 francs each) to resell in her town.

With the profits, she is planning on taking care of her family so much more, since she has been a widow for years. She plans on paying the water bills and covering her children’s education costs, especially those of her youngest child.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
For the past three years, Angelita has run a sari-sari (variety) store, which is the family's main source of income. She sells commodities like noodles, milk, sugar, seasonings, soap, shampoo and assorted canned goods. She is married woman with three children. Her oldest is 13 while the youngest is 1. Her husband is a driver.

At this time, she needs additional funds to cater to her financial needs. She decided to join CEVI, to avail loan for her child in order to pay for school fees and purchase books.

In this way, the capital for her business will be retained and she will continue to strive hard to support the daily needs of her family.

For the future, Angelita is looking forward to continue to seek ways to become more productive.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and purchase books

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is a resident in the town of Maribojoc. She is a widow woman and has three grown children.

She raises and sells hogs. She has been raising hogs for a quite period of time now.

Cirila needs funds to support her existing project. She has requested a loan to invest in feed and vitamins. It could boost her income and allow her to continue to handle the business properly. With an adequate supply of feed, she would able to raise quality hogs, enabling her to set aside some of the profit for emergency use. And slowly, she could able to settle her obligations and continue to manage her earnings wisely.

She is hoping that someday, she will become more productive and be able to expand her piggery livelihood.

loans.use: to  invest in feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman and has three children, one of whom is still attending school. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities such as coffee, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste, fabric conditioner and a variety of canned goods. She lives in the rural town of Loon, together with her husband and children.

She is asking for a loan to buy a sack of rice, soft drinks and groceries. With the presence of that, she would be able to maintain the inventory and attract potential customers to shop. In that way, her financial gain could be improved.

Helen is hopeful that someday her livelihood would be successful for the welfare of her children and a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, soft drinks and groceries

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to open another business outlet within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be outgoing. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. Her business goal is to have a large business outlet within five years. This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to cater for family needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and a resident of Tondo, Philippines. Buying and selling children’s wear is her source of living, together with her husband, Alexander, who’s helping her with the business. They’re selling the items in the market and have been engaged in the business for 17 years already. Their monthly earnings are approximately PHP 20,000, which they’re using to support their children’s education and for their daily expenses.

According to Lydia, over the past 6 months the business is continually growing and she considered it as a blessing from God. Another answered prayer was when she knew about Center for Community Transformation (CCT), that nurtures aspiring entrepreneurs. She wants to have their own house and lot someday and be able to continually support the education of her children.

She decided to apply for a PHP 20, 000 loan to buy more stocks of children’s wear so that customers will have a variety of designs and sizes to choose from, resulting in an increase of the business’ revenue.

Lydia has been consistent in attending CCT fellowship group which consists of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners. This made her become strong spiritually and dependent on God on every occasion.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of children's wear for her buy and sell business.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a hardworking woman who is currently selling ready-to-wear clothes. She's been running the business for 10 years already, but her marketing strategy is what she still needs to make the business grow. She’s been a longtime member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and she takes advantage every time the conduct seminars for entrepreneurs. Her estimated business profit is PHP 38,000 every month.

Jennifer wants to add more stock of ready-to-wear clothes to her current business. She dreams of having her own mall in the future, which is possible if you persevere as an entrepreneur. Jennifer is applying for a PHP 20,000 loan to buy different designs of ready-to-wear clothes so that her customers will have a variety of choices. By determination and perseverance she believes that the business will grow with the help of God. She’s hoping that her request will be approved by CCT to have added capital for the new business.

Jennifer regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience the business, to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship, and to listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy different designs of ready-to-wear clothes for her buy-and-sell business.

loans.name: Bubandi 111 Group

texts.en:
Rose is a member of Bubandi 111 group, in which members guarantee each other to obtain a loan. Her business is cocoa trading, which she has been doing since 2005. 

The responsibilities of looking after her children forced her to engage in business since it’s her duty as a parent to do so. She works hard to ensure that she plays her roles fully, only to be limited by seasonal vagaries--especially the rainy season, which makes it difficult to dry up the cocoa to the required low-moisture content. 

Her dream is to start exporting cocoa to Kenyan markets that offer attractive prices. Rose will use the loan to buy cocoa to sell in big tonnes.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell in big tonnes.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima lives in Baqaa. She is a 43 year old married woman with three children. One of those kids is Muhannad who appears in the photo instead of Fatima because she is a conservative woman.

Fatima is keen on raising her children and giving them the best education. Her son Muhannad is studying Chemistry. He chose this major because he believes that it will be easy to find work in this area.

His father is retired and his pension is not enough to cover Muhannad`s university fees. Therefore Fatima applied for an education loan to help her son pay his semester fees and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: help her son pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a single man living in Salheye which is affected so much by the Syrian refugees. He is studying to get his bachelor degree in mathematics, and he is now in his second year. The income that is coming from his father's job is not enough to cover all household expenses. Recently Omar's father has been facing some problems which led Omar to apply for an educational loan to help him cover his semester fees. Omar's future plan is to work in the same field and help his family.

loans.use: to cover his semester fees.

loans.name: Rillent

texts.en:
Rillent is a 36-year-old woman who is married with two children. She lives in a rural community outside of Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She owns and operates a small general store selling food items such as rice, noodles, biscuits and canned food. She has been doing this for two years.

Rillent requested a loan to more buy food items to assist her in running the business. She hopes to meet her family's daily expenses with the profit she makes and also plan to expand her business in the future.

She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, biscuits and canned food for her general store.

loans.name: Maximina Yamileth

texts.es:
Maximina tiene 28 años de edad, ella vive con su esposo y su hijo en la casa de su madre con sus dos hermanos, su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa en la capital. 

Maximina se dedica a trabajar como empleada en una farmacia cerca de su casa a ella le sale muy bien el trabajo ya que así puede estar cerca de su casa y estar pendiente de su hijo. Ella lleva ya casi 4 años de trabajar ahí y siente que es una gran ayuda para ella y su esposo ya que son varios gastos los que deben de cubrir. 

Maximina  tiene la iniciativa de poner un negocio, es por eso que necesita este crédito para comprar blusas, pantalones, ropa interior y otras ropas para damas, además se acerca la época navideña y piensa que le irá bien.

Los planes de Maximina  son poder ahorrar junto a su esposo para construir su propia casa y vivir tranquilos.
texts.en:
Maximina is 28 years old. She lives with her husband and son in her mother's house with her two brothers. Her husband works as an employee for a company in the capital.

Maximina works as an employee in a pharmacy near her house, which works very well for her since this way she can be close to home and look after her son. She has worked at the pharmacy for almost four years now and feels that it is a big help to her and her husband, since they have many costs to cover.

Maximina has the initiative to start a business. This is why she needs this loan to buy blouses, trousers, undergarments and other ladies' clothing. Besides, with the Christmas season getting closer, she thinks it will go well for her.

Maximina's plans are to be able to save money along with her husband in order to build their own house and live a quiet life.

loans.use: to buy blouses, trousers, undergarments, and other ladies' clothing.

loans.name: Phylistus

texts.en:
Phylistus is 26 years old; she is married with two children. She lives in a rural community within the Honiara city, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She operates a small general store selling food items such as rice, noodles, biscuits, snacks and toiletries to the community to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years.

Phylistus needs a loan to buy more food items to assist her in running the business. She plan to use her profit to expand her general store and with the little she makes, help cover her family's weekly expenses.

She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy, rice, noodles and cooking oil for her general store.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita has always the enthusiasm of farming. She cultivates her rice land in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds to have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Carmelita knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. In the future, Carmelita hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing and caring to harvesting, and is earning income as well. Lourdes supports her husband in doing this type of work.

Like a farmer, Lourdes has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs.

Recently, Lourdes applied a loan to purchase rice seeds so she will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Someday, Lourdes hopes to purchase more rice land to cultivate that, which will potentially add income for her family.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds.

loans.name: Ana Gina

texts.en:
Ana Gina is a 50-year-old married woman who has no dependents. Together with her husband, she lives in Barili, Cebu.

She earns a living by selling barbecue, such as chicken, pork, and hot dogs. Aside from that, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store selling commodities like sugar, edible oil, coffee, soap, toothpaste, noodles, and canned goods.

She decided to join CEVI to access loans and boost her business. With the 12,000 PHP loan, she wants to buy supplies such as meat, seasonings, and bamboo skewers, and to pay for store renovations.

With these, she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family and continue to become more progressive in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as meat, seasonings, and bamboo skewers, and to pay for store renovations.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a native from the town of Loon. She makes a living through hog raising. She is married and has five grown children. Her husband is a carpenter.

Juliet has been raising and selling hogs for two years, serving neighbors and nearby residents. She wants to improve the quality of hogs she is going to raise. She needs additional capital to become more productive. She wants to purchase feed and vitamins.

She is hoping that someday her business will become sustainable to improve the present living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en: Dionesio has always had the enthusiasm for farming. He cultivates his rice land in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, he applied for a loan to pay for land and seed bed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Dionesio knows that he has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

loans.use: to pay for land and seed bed preparations.

loans.name: Rolant

texts.en:
Rolant is 37 years old. He lives in the Akhalkalaki District with his pensioner mother, brother and sister-in-law. The family grows potatoes on family-owned agricultural land. Rolant sells harvested potatoes locally. He decided to use this experience and start trading fruits and vegetables.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3000 GEL. With the received credit he will start trading fruits and vegetables and will generate a stable income.

loans.use: to begin to trade fruits and vegetables in order to generate a stable income and improve the living conditions for his family.

loans.name: Miranika

texts.en:
Miranika is a 35-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and two children in Tsalenjikha District. Miranika is unemployed and has a great desire to open a beauty salon.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2000 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase all the needed equipment and accessories and will open a beauty salon. Miranika will run the beauty salon and will generate a stable income. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a beauty salon

loans.name: Kasanga Thuyikulhaye Group

texts.en:
Janet is 40 years old and a member of Kasanga group, in which members guarantee one another to acquire a group loan without pledging any security. She is a single mother with a responsibility of looking after two children.

Janet operates a bar, having been in business for 10 years. She started with capital of 200,000 thousand and her business has grown as her capital has also increased. She has a dream of not letting her children down till they complete school. She is faced with a challenge of bad debtors. However, she desires to have a bigger bar and sell big.

For now, Janet is requesting money to buy more beers for selling during the festive season.

loans.use: To buy more beers for selling during the festive season.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en: Ramil is 17 years old. He is a very diligent and passionate person. Ramil is IDP from Bilasuvar refugee settlement. He is living with his large family and also helps his old parents. He has 2 brothers and sister. At this young age, he just finished his studies and he knows that he has great responsibilities in both earning income and supporting family, because his parents are both not eligible for work. He is a farmer and people in his neighborhood call him as an honest young farmer. He is very energetic. He grows some wheat. Ramil likes to provide more natural products to people. Being a refugee and from the region where people are more familiar with farming, gives him more advantage in the local market. He is more familiar with local area people and knows the peoples' needs and demands. In Azerbaijan people consume a lot of wheat such as rural area people bake their own bread and make pastries, cakes at home. Ramil has advantage, because people trust him and. Currently he is planning to buy more fertilizers for this he needs 1200 AZN. Hopefully Kiva lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en:
Manzura has been a widow since 1994. She is caring mother of three children. Manzura has experienced a lot of difficulties as she has brought up her children alone and she is the only one who provides their education and food.

Manzura has her own business, dealing in buying and selling food items in a local market. She sells different kinds of food items like sausage, milk products, bread, biscuits, candies, etc.

Manzura is going to increase her working capital because doing business in a local market is a big struggle. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy food items for increasing her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy food items for increasing working capital

loans.name: Hawraa

texts.en: Hwraa is a 23-year-old, single woman living with her parents. Her father is the main income source in the family, and as for her, she is only focusing on her school. Today, with the aim to pay her school fees, she said that she is very happy. Her only target is to achieve her education suitably and to be able to achieve higher levels, and to help her father with the expenses.

loans.use: to pay her school fees.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsa is a 37-year-old Lebanese married woman who lives with her husband and one child. Her husband is the main income of the family. She has worked as a private teacher since 2005. She chose this profession as she feels that she is helping students to get the needed education. She prepared a special room in her house in 2012 where she receives her students.

Today, Swasan is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy books, materials and supplies to help her in her work and to improve her teaching skills. She is very optimistic about her future and wishes to receive more students with the coming school season.

loans.use: to buy books and materials to help her in her work and to improve her teaching skills

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Forty-three-year-old Leonora owns a motorcycle. This unit is used to transport passengers in their community who wants to go to the nearby village. Her husband is the one who drives their motorcycle for an income while she spends her time as a copra dealer while also raising hogs. These small businesses allow her to meet the needs of her four children aged 10, 13, 15 and 17. She is asking for a loan to buy feed, copra and food for the family. Leonora’s only dream is for her children to finish their studies in college.

loans.use: to buy feed, copra and food for the family

loans.name: Ma. Editha

texts.en:
Ma. Editha has been raising hogs for six years now. She lives in the rural town of Loon with her husband and three grown children. She has sold hogs to locals and nearby residents. 

Raising hogs is in demand now. She would like to raise quality hogs but she has not been able to finance its maintenance.
 
Ma. Editha join CEVI to access loan and wants to purchase feed, vitamins and food for the family. These could boost her income and enable her to manage to support her family and provide better living conditions for them.

She is determined that someday, she will continue to expand by increasing the number of livestock and eventually improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and food for the family.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC for almost 10 years. She and her husband has been tilling their own land for a farming activity that primarily provides the needs of their family.

Evelyn found out that their income in farming is insufficient for the family needs, especially when their eldest child enters college. As a hardworking farmer, she also nurtured and worked hard to repay her loans from the cooperative.

One time, Evelyn decided to expand her farm and asked for financial support from Paglaum MPC. She is grateful of the trust the coop had extended to her and was able to buy the neighboring parcel of land. She successfully repaid that loan, and for this crop season, she asked for another loan to augment her production.

This loan amount of PHP 40,000 is intended to purchase bags of fertilizers and bottles of insecticides. Evelyn is hopeful that she can have a good harvest this season so that she can repay ahead of schedule her loan with the cooperative.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Helen tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital.

Helen borrowed another loan to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give her farming income a big boost. Helen looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Eltrudes

texts.en:
Eltrudes learned about Paglaum MPC in the year 2010. As a farmer in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to jump start her rice production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Eltrudes feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business.

Recently, Eltrudes borrowed another loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next crop season. Eltrudes wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Floreta

texts.en:
Floreta makes a good earning on her farming activities in Mahayag. This is how she supports her family and send her children to school.

Floreta wants to increase her farm yield especially because she will have high cost of living when her children enter college. Floreta approached Paglaum for a loan amount to purchase rice seeds so she will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca has a rice farm in Mahayag. This is her primary source of income for her family.

Rebecca makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and have good income. Recently, she needed a loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase rice seeds so she will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

Rebecca wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is getting ready for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well, especially the much needed land and seedbed preparations. She wants to purchase rice seeds to have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. For that reason, she applied for a loan from the Cooperative. Eva hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds.

loans.name: Judelyn

texts.en:
Judelyn has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing and caring to harvesting, and in earning income as well. Judelyn supporpts her husband in doing this type of work.

Like a farmer, Judelyn has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs.

Recently, Judelyn applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds so she will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Someday, Judelyn hopes to purchase more rice land to cultivate and that will potentially add income for her family.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
April Joy is 15 years old and is the fourth of seven children in the family. Her mother Ma. Teresa supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

April Joy is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Accountancy and is currently in the first year of this four-year course.

Ma. Teresa is borrowing PHP 9,000 to pay for tuition fees for her daughter for the second semester of the 2015-16 school year.

April Joy plans to graduate and be gainfully employed in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Agricula

texts.en:
Agricula is 49 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy more candies, canned goods, soft drinks, sanitary pads, shampoo, beers, etc. to sell.

Agricula has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from buying and selling purified drinking water.

Agricula aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more candies, canned goods, soft drinks, sanitary pads, shampoo, beers, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is 56 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rose Marie has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of rice to sell.

She has been in this business for two years.
In the future Rose Marie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is 46 years old. She is a widow living in Harij village with her mother-in-law. Her two sons had to leave the country as migrant workers, because of the high unemployment rate and bad economic situation in the region.

Hasmik alone takes care of their family farm that provides a very important source of income for them. She is involved mainly in land cultivation, growing and selling potatoes, garlic, carrots, beans, and cabbage.

The main difficulty Hasmik has is the cost of transporting the gathered harvest to the market. She has requested this loan to purchase potatoes, wheat seeds, fertilizer and oxen to enlarge the farm and get more income for the family.

Hasmik hopes to have rich and successful farming business, so her sons will come back home.

loans.use: to pay for potatoes, wheat seeds, fertilizer and oxen to enlarge her farm and get more income for the family.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is a designer by profession, working and living in Vanadzor town. She receives different orders to prepare various things to decorate for special evenings and houses.

Gohar is asking for this loan to purchase tools and materials to provide her designing works. She would be very grateful to receive lenders' support and have new tools for her work.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials to provide designing services for her customers

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells commodities like noodles, milk, sugar, seasonings, soap, shampoo, and assorted canned goods. She is a widowed woman and has four grown children. She resides in the town of Barili.

She has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store for quite a period of time, serving neighbors in her place.

She would like to improve her business to become more productive and improve the family’s living conditions.

Gloria would like to purchase additional stock for the store such as soft drinks, toiletries and cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for the store, such as soft drinks, toiletries, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Dexter

texts.en:
Dexter owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells merchandise like cooking oil, seasonings, coffee, powdered milk, pouch vinegar, soap, shampoo, eggs, and toiletries.

He lives in the town of Barili, with his child and his partner in life, which is his greatest joy.

Dexter would like to fill his store with basic necessities, but the problem is, he doesn't have enough capital to stock what is lacking in his inventory.

He wants to purchase rice, pig feed, and assorted groceries. These will keep the inventory of his store stocked, causing more buyers to come.

He is hoping that he can make it more sustainable for the welfare of his family.

loans.use: to purchase rice, pig feed, and assorted groceries.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is a 52-year-old woman who does domestic work for a living. She lives in her own home with her five children, two of whom are still attending school. She has been selling snack food in nearby schools. She sells camote cue, which is deep fried sweet potato mixed with caramelized sugar, as well as fried peanuts and chicharron (fried pork meat).

Ninfa is asking for a loan to purchase additional ingredients like flour, sugar, sweet potatoes and edible oil. With these ingredients, she can prepare and sell a variety of snacks, enabling her to continue to provide for the needs of her family. She would also be able to roll out the capital in such a way as to continue to set aside some of the profit for future use.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, sugar, sweet potatoes and edible oil.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old, married, and has 12 children, nine of whom attend school. Mary operates a shrimp vending business, which she has been doing for many years.  She sells to the locals in her town. Her husband is a fisherman. He sells fish and owns a pond that cultures shrimp.

Mary requested a loan, which she will use to purchase shrimp fingerlings. The loan will help augment her husband's source of income by improving his  yield and eventually gaining higher earnings. In the future, Mary would like to invest in other possible business opportunities to be able to continue to finance the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to purchase shrimp fingerlings

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities such as bread, coffee, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste, fabric conditioner and a variety of canned goods.

She is a married woman and has four children, three of whom are still attending school. Together with her family, she lives in the town of Getafe.

She is asking for a loan to buy assorted groceries such as beverages, cooking oil, seasonings and soft drinks for the store. With these, she will be able to maintain the inventory and attract potential customers to her shop. She plans to set aside some of the profit for expansion.

Victoriana is determined that she could make her store to be more productive so as to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries such as beverages, cooking oil, seasonings and soft drinks for the store.

loans.name: Viviana Margarita

texts.es: Viviana es una mujer de 34 años que reside en Cartagena de Indias, ella es soltera y está dedicada a su negocio de venta de comidas y bebidas, actividad que heredó de su padre quien la motivo a emprender su propio negocio; él fue su principal apoyo puesto que le aportó el capital inicial para que adquiriera la estufa industrial, los utensilios de cocina, materias primas e insumos. En la actualidad cuenta con un año de experiencia y una clientela fidelizada a la que diariamente atiende en la terraza de su vivienda a partir de las 7 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m., y les ofrece una variada carta de comidas corrientes, sancochos, refrescos, gaseosas y cervezas. Viviana necesita apoyo financiero para comprar canastas de cervezas al por mayor e insumos para sus comidas es por ello que realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo y llevar a cabo su proyecto. Viviana a futuro desea tener un restaurante con empleados y formalizar un hogar.
texts.en: Viviana is a 34-year-old woman who lives in Cartagena de Indias. She is single and has her business selling meals and drinks. She inherited this work from her father, who motivated her to start her own business. He was her main support since he gave her the initial capital so that she could get an industrial stove, cooking utensils, raw materials, and supplies. Currently she has a year of experience and a loyal clientele that she waits on every day on her house's terrace from 7 am until 8 pm. She offers them a varied menu of fast food, stews, soft drinks, sodas, and beer. Viviana needs financial support in order to buy cases of beer wholesale and supplies for her meals. That is why she requested a loan, a Kiva loan, an opportunity to link up with the financial world through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and carry out her project. In the future, Viviana wants to have a restaurant with employees and to put together a home.

loans.use: to buy cases of beer wholesale and supplies for her meals

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a 45-year-old married woman who owns a furniture shop. She makes catering tables, dining tables, doors and cabinets made of wood. She started managing this business seven years ago to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She has five dependents; three of whom are still attending school.
 
She is a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop her business. She is also a sacrificing mother who deprives herself for the sake of her children.  She has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner CEVI, to purchase materials like varnish and wood; and for laborers' fees.

Evangeline hopes to expand her business more in the future through investing in other business ventures to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials like varnish and wood; and for laborers' fees.

loans.name: Relwende De Goue Group

texts.fr:
Mme  SANATA est la représentante du groupe RELWENDE DE GOUE. Mariée, elle est mère  de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 24 ans et le moins âgé a 06 ans.  06 enfants  vont  à l’école et elle a 05 personnes en charges.
Mme fait du maraîchage  depuis 13 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les boutiques de son village.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte s’acheter 01 sac d’engrais et 03 bidons d’insecticide pour avoir de bonnes  cultures.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour rembourser son crédit et payer la scolarité de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne devenir une grossiste et contribuer à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. SANATA is the representative of the group RELWENDE DE GOUE. A married woman, she is the mother of six children. The oldest is 24 years old, and the youngest is 6. Six children go to school. She has five persons to support.

SANATA has been working in the domain of market gardening for thirteen years. She gets her supplies from the shop in her village.

With the money granted, she intends to purchase a sack of fertilizer and 3 containers of insecticide in order to have good crops.

She wants to use the profits from the loan to pay back her loan and cover her children’s schooling costs. Her ambitions is to become a wholesaler and to help improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of fertilizer and 2 containers of insecticide for her crops

loans.name: Heshima Group

texts.fr: Béatrice est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire «Heshima», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 35 ans mère 4 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des planches et de la braise dans un dépôt du bidonville depuis 7 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 400 planches et 10 sacs de braises. Elle débuta par le fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite construire une maison et scolariser ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Nous tenons à signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés
texts.en:
Béatrice is a shopkeeper and a member of Heshima borrowing group, a client of MFI [microfinance institution] Hekima. Béatrice is 35 years old, married, and the mother of four children who all attend school. Béatrice has been selling pieces of wood and charcoal in a township warehouse for seven years. She is going to purchase supplies of 400 pieces of wood and 10 sacks of charcoal.

Béatrice started [her business] with funds she received from her husband. She would like to build a house and pay for her children's education. Finally, Béatrice would like to thank Hekima for the support they provide to entrepreneurs who lack access to finance through the traditional banking system. Please note that some clients [in the photo] are carrying their children.

loans.use: to purchase supplies of 400 pieces of wood and 10 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Marvin Adonay

texts.es:
Marvin es un muchacho de 22 años de edad, él estudió hasta bachillerato, actualmente trabaja como empleado de una farmacia, está soltero y no tiene hijos, vive con su madre y sus tres hermanos y él es quien mantiene la casa con su trabajo. 

Marvin se dedica trabajar como empleado de una farmacia, él trabaja ahí desde hace 4 años, prácticamente desde que se graduó de bachiller, gracias a su trabajo ha podido salir adelante con su familia y lograr que sus hermanos estudien también. Su trabajo le gusta mucho ya que es de horario flexible y puede llegar a su casa en pocos minutos, además posee una tienda en la cual se involucran sus demás familiares.

Marvin necesita del crédito para comprar golosinas, rinso, pan dulce y otros artículos para surtir la tienda.

Los planes de Marvin para el futuro son poder seguir estudiando en la universidad y tener un mejor trabajo para seguir ayudando a sus hermanos y a su madre.
texts.en:
Marvin is a 22 year old young man. He studied until high school, and now works at a pharmacy. He is single and has no children, and lives with his mother and three siblings. It is he who supports the household with his job.

Marvin works as an employee at a pharmacy, where he has worked for 4 years, more or less since he left school. Thanks to his work he has been able to get ahead with his family and ensure that his siblings can also study. He likes his job very much, as he has a flexible timetable and is very close to his home. He also has a store in which his family also get involved.

Marvin needs a loan to buy candy, detergent, sweet bread and other products to stock the store.

Marvin's plans for the future are to continue his education at university and have a better job to continue helping his siblings and his mother.

loans.use: to buy candy, detergent, sweet bread and other products to stock his store.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit, using his own car, has been involved in the taxi driving business. He lives with his parents and is the main breadwinner of the family.

Davit lives and works in Stepanavan town, but besides driving a taxi in the town he also takes passengers long distances. Davit requested this loan to prepare his work for the winter season. With the loan's help Davit will purchase new winter tires and renovate the engine of the car to continue taxi driving and gathering income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for new winter tires and renovation of the engine of the car to continue taxi driving and gathering income for his family.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres luchadoras  se formó con el objetivo de obtener un medio de ayuda para todas las integrantes del grupo, de manera a que cada una trabaje en equipo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Yessica es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica al servicio de la decoración, ella brinda su servicio de decoración a todo tipo de eventos, y gracias a que tiene muy buen servicio, es conocida y está creciendo poco a poco.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, apliques, y otros insumos para poder usar en decoración, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
the "Mujeres Luchardoras" communal bank came together with the objective of the members all helping each other. Thus, each member could work as part of a team in order to improve her and her loved ones' living conditions.

Yessica is one member of this group. She makes a living as a decorator. She decorates all types of events. As she provides very good service, she is well-known and her business is gradually expanding.

Yessica is applying for this loan in order to buy material, appliqués and more supplies to use in her decorating work. She will thus be able to continue with her trade.

loans.use: to buy material, appliqués and more.

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Alegria se formó en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras que quieren salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, esforzándose por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Romina quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante, es por ello que se esfuerza mucho para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo. Romina comenta que poco a poco ha ido creciendo y mejorando, y es por ello que siempre pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder lograrlo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, como ser: remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones, vestidos y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The "La Algeria" lending group started in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. The members of the group are hardworking women who want to get ahead. They are striving to eliminate poverty by pushing themselves to improve their living conditions. One of the members, Romina, works selling clothing. She is a hardworking woman who wants to get ahead, which is why she works hard to support her family with her work. Romina states that little by little, she has grown and become a better person, which is why she continue to work hard.

She is seeking a loan to purchase a variety of clothing to sell such as: shirts, jeans, t-shirts, pants, dresses, etc. This way, she will be able to continue with her work and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: purchase a variety of clothing to sell such as: shirts, jeans, t-shirts, pants, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Paula Emilia

texts.es:
La socia sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “VIRGENCITA DEL CARMEN DE HUYCHO”.
Paula continua dedicándose a su negocio de venta de verduras, mediante esta actividad aporta en su hogar y quiere ampliar su mercadería que le permita tener mas posibilidades de salir adelante junto a su familia.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar zanahorias, lechugas y tomates ; estos productos son indispensable para que su negocio siga creciendo.
Paula esta agradecida con los inversionistas de KIVA por el crédito otorgado ya que le ayudara mucho en su negocio y también asegura pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
This member is still a member of the communal bank "Virgencita del Carmen de Huycho".

Paula continues with her business selling vegetables, through which she contributes to her household. She wishes to expand her goods which will give her more opportunities to get ahead with her family.

She is requesting loan to buy carrots, lettuce and tomatoes: all products which are indispensable for the growth of her business.

Paula is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan, as it will help a great deal with her business, and she promises that she will make repayments punctually.

loans.use: to buy carrots, lettuce and tomatoes

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
54-year-old Leonarda owns a rice paddy. She has been growing rice for many years now. She is married and has four children. Two of her children are still attending school. She is striving hard to improve her income. She lives in the town of Talibon. Her husband's way of earning a living is through fishing. 

She would like to avail a loan to purchase fertiliser and a motorcycle. That motorcycle will be used for ease of transporting her yield, and at the same time, be used for habal-habal (a mode of transportation that enables travel to remote areas), which will help her to gain higher income for the entire family.

Leonarda is thankful to Kiva for the continued support.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and a motorcycle.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina and her husband own a furniture business in the town of Valencia in Bohol. They make cabinets, tables, chairs and other types of furniture according to customer orders. Marina also manages a hog-raising business. She is asking for a loan to increase her production. She needs funds to buy plywood, varnish and feed for her hogs. Once these are taken cared of, Marina will be able to focus on making the most of her livelihood and increase her production to accommodate more orders and thus increase her income.

loans.use: to buy plywood, varnish and feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 38-year-old married woman who engages in a mineral water vending business. She serves neighbors and nearby residents in her area. She lives in her own home with her five children. Her eldest child is 17 while the youngest is 6. Her husband is a fish vendor.

Vilma is asking for a loan to purchase livestock and more stocks of mineral water. These are very essential as they help to augment her earnings. She would also raise livestock for supplemental income. She would like to enhance her livelihood and be able to continue to support the needs of her family.

In the future, she is hoping that she will be able to manage both her businesses in order to have a stable source of income for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and more stocks of mineral water.

loans.name: Humura Group

texts.fr:
M. Chantal  fait partie du groupe  Humura et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle  a 38 ans et est mariée  à Shadrack, un tailleur. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants âgés de 2 à 16 ans, dont 5  étudient.
 
Elle fait le  métier de tailleur   depuis  14 ans. 

Elle est à son douzième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de   fils à coudre, de popeline pour servir plus de clients, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait  acheter une parcelle  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en: M. Chantal is part of the Humura group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 38 years old and is married to Shadrack, a tailor. Together they have seven children aged 2 to 16 years old, of which 5 are studying. She has been a tailor for 14 years. This is her twelfth loan with Turame. With the KIVA credit, she will increase her capital to buy many sewing threads and poplin to serve more customers and earn more money. In the coming years, she would like to buy a land parcel and see her children study.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy many sewing threads and poplin to serve more customers and earn more money.

loans.name: Kotognongontala Group

texts.fr:
Diamako  fait le commerce d’arachide, âgé de51 ans  Malienne, marié et mère  de 3 enfants âgés de 12 à 20 ans dont 1 fréquente l’école. Elle est celle dont la tasse est plaine d’arachide devant sur la photo, Son mari est cultivateur.
Diamako exerce ce métier il y a 12 ans de cela, elle s’approvisionne et vend ses arachides aux  marchés de sa localité. Une femme très dévouée dans son travail elle a toujours bien remboursé ses emprunts auprès du RMCR
Elle sollicite un prêt pour accroitre son commerce d’arachide,les bénéfices générés par le prêt servira à  prendre en charges certains besoins de la famille tel que soins de santé, habillement . 
Après les ventes il peut réaliser un bénéfice de 20 000 fcfa, son rêve d’être une grande commerçante dans la zone  pour bien vendre ses articles à tous ceux qui sont dans le besoin.
texts.en:
Diamako, 51 years old, sells ground nuts. She is Malian, married, and the mother of three children between the ages of 12 and 20, one of whom attends school. Diamako is the woman whose bowl is full of ground nuts in the photo, at the front. Her husband is a farmer.

Diamako has been involved in this business for 12 years. She gets her supplies and sells her ground nuts in the markets in her area. A woman who is very devoted to her business, Diamako has always properly repaid her loans from RMCR.

Diamako is seeking a loan to expand her ground nut business. The profits generated by the loan will allow her to see to several family needs, such as health care and clothing.

From her sales, Diamako can see a profit of 20,000 CFA francs. Her dream is be a major retailer in the region in order to sell her wares to all those who need them.

loans.use: to purchase ground nuts.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Divino Niño Jesus está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, son mujeres muy trabajadoras, que se unieron para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos, a través del trabajo en equipo.
La señora Basilica, integrante del grupo, ayuda al Sostenimiento de su familia con la venta de Chipa que lo realiza diariamente desde muy tempranas horas. La chipa es un alimento típico paraguayo que es consumido todo el año en el país. Basilica es una mujer muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante, y es por ello que se esfuerza mucho para poder salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder hacer sus chipas, como ser queso, huevo, manteca, y otros insumos, de manera a poder seguir esforzándose y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The "Divino Niño Jesus" group are in their second cycle of the Women's Committee Program. They are very hardworking women, who have come together to improve their living conditions as well as that of their respective families, through working together.

Basilica, a member of this group, works to sustain her family through the sales of chipas, which she does every day, from very early in the morning. Chipas are a traditional Paraguayan food consumed throughout the year in the country. Basilica is a very hardworking woman who wants to get ahead, which is why she works so hard to do so.

She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients to make chipas, including cheese, eggs and butter, so that she can continue to work hard and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy cheese, eggs and butter and other ingredients.

loans.name: Felinda

texts.en: Felinda is a mother of three. Her children are aged 2, 10 and 15. She is a responsible wife and mother. While her husband works abroad to provide for them, she makes the most out of her time and resources so that she can earn a living too while taking care of her children. She is engaged in a sari-sari store business. She also sells prepaid mobile top-up to cellphone users. She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise such as milo sachets, milk, sugar, toothpaste, hair conditioner, canned food, biscuits and prepaid retailer top-up. Felinda dreams of improving her business so that she can generate more income to meet her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy prepaid retailer mobile top-up, milo sachets, milk, sugar, toothpaste, hair conditioner canned food and biscuits.

loans.name: Ventura

texts.es:
Ventura es un señor de 69 años de edad, él es trabajador, responsable y honrado muy conocido  en su comunidad, vive con su compañera de vida quien se dedica a ser ama de casa, todos sus hijos están en el extranjero pues decidieron partir en busca de mejores oportunidades. 

Ventura es agricultor desde que tiene uso de razón, tiene un cultivo de huertas de plátano del cual ha cosechado durante tres años seguidos la cantidad de mas de 500 racimos de plátanos en perfectas condiciones para vender y se siente muy orgulloso de su platanar.

 Ventura necesita del crédito para pagar mano de obra que le ayude a recoger su cosecha de plátanos y también comprará fertilizantes para la nueva siembra.


Los planes de ventura son llegar a tener una plantación de plátano enorme y próspera, esa es su ambición más grande.
texts.en:
Ventura is a 69 year old man. He is hardworking, responsible, honorable, and well known in the community. He lives with his wife who is a homemaker. All of his children live outside of the country as they left in order to find better opportunities. Ventura has been a farmer for as long as he can recall. He has a plantain plantation that he has harvested for three years. He has over 500 bunches of plantains in perfect condition to sell, and he is very proud of his yield. 

Ventura is in need of a loan to pay for labor to help him harvest his plantain crops, and to purchase fertilizers for his new crops. Ventura's plans are to have a huge and prosperous plantain plantation, that is his biggest dream.

loans.use: pay for labor to help harvest his plantain crops, and purchase fertilizers for his new crops.

loans.name: Jesenia Fabiola

texts.es: Jesenia  tiene 25 años de edad, es de estado civil casada, su esposo es jornalero, tienen un hijos, Matías de 6 años de edad, ella se dedica a la producción de leche, en esta actividad ya lleva más de  5  años, esto le permite obtener ganancias para los gastos de su hogar, solicita de este crédito para la compra de una vaca de leche, así podrá obtener más litros de leche y sus ganancias aumentaran, y así podrá  ayudar con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Jesenia, 25 years old, is married to a day laborer. Together, they have a son names Matias who is 6 years old. She works in the dairy business, which she has done for more than five years. This job allows her to make a living.

She is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow so that she can produce more milk and increase her earnings. This way, she will be able to help with the household expenses.

loans.use: purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Miguel Alfredo

texts.es:
El socio continúa perteneciendo al banco comunal “virgencita del carmen de huycho”.
Miguel Alfredo sigue dedicándose a su labor de maestro constructor, con esta actividad aporta en su hogar para que su familia tenga mejor calidad de vida.
El socio solicito el préstamo para comprar casco, botas de jebe y herramientas de trabajo. El necesita comprar estas cosas para poder trabajar seguro y  brindar mejor sus servicios a las personas que confían en él y que lo contratan.
El socio está agradecido con los inversionistas de KIVA por seguir confiando en el y su esfuerzo y nos asegura que pagara sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
The member continues to belong to the "Virgencita del Carmen de Huycho" communal bank.

Miguel Alfredo continues his work as a master builder. With this work he contributes to his household so that his family will have a better quality of life.

The member is asking for the loan to buy a helmet, rubber boots, and work tools. He needs to buy these things in order to be able to work safely and to better provide his services to the people who trust him and hire him.

The member is thankful to the KIVA lenders for continuing to trust him and his effort and he promises us that he will make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy a helmet, rubber boots, and work tools

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El señor vive en la población de Entre Ríos del trópico de Cochabamba, el señor es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive con su madre, trabaja en el área agrícola dedicándose a la producción de yuca en su terreno agrícola propio el cual lo adquirió con mucho esfuerzo después cuando fue a asentarse a tierras con su tío hace dos años atrás, al año cultiva 1 hectárea y media de yuca, de donde comercializa 600 quintales a comerciantes que van a comprarle a su misma actividad económica esta  producción es su fuente de sustento económico, el señor es una persona responsable que tiene el deseo de salir adelante y siempre trabaja duramente para seguir progresando día a día y colaborar con los gastos familiares a su madre. Pero en su trabajar diario surgió un problema de salud con su señora madre, debido a que diagnosticaron quiste de ovario, por lo  cual tiene que ser intervenida quirúrgicamente de manera inmediata, para ello el señor requiere un préstamo para ayudar con los gastos médicos a su madre.
texts.en:
This man lives in the town of Entre Ríos del tropic de Cochabamba. He is single and childless. He lives with his mother and works in agriculture, growing yucca on his farm. He acquired this land two years ago with a lot of hard work when he settled it with his uncle. He produces about an acre and a half of yucca every year and he sells about 600 bushels to merchants. This work is his main source of income. He is a responsible person with a desire to get ahead, and he always works hard in order to continue growing everyday and helping his mother with the household expenses.

Recently, his mother became ill, having been diagnosed with an ovarian cyst, and is now in need of immediate surgery. For this reason, this man is seeking a loan to help with his mother's medical expenses.

loans.use: pay medical expenses for his mother who is ill and needs treatment to return to normal.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 40 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Rowena is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Rowena has been in pig fattening for 8 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Berlinda

texts.en:
Berlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 10,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more firewood to sell for her buy and sell firewood business.

Berlinda has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from farming corn.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Berlinda dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 42 years old and has six children. Florenda is married, and three of her children are currently in school.

Florenda is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Florenda requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Florenda has been in pig fattening for six years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Florenda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Victor de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con su familia, el está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas trasmayos para la pesca y así poder continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Victor, aged 31, lives in a home he owns with his spouse and two children.

He has earned a living from traditional fishing for several years, and he sells his products in the various markets near his home.

With his earnings, he is able to get ahead with his family. He is again requesting a loan to buy more fishing nets. This way he will be able to continue with his work, as it is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy more fishing nets.

loans.name: Kantu De San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa, continua con su  negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia lleva años dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería  sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades, familiares entre otros, la socia continua vendiendo  lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita le crédito para comprar colonias entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ponches, negocio de carpintería, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La socia que sale adjunta a la foto pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The partners belong to the community bank "KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO". This bank is in the Cusco district which is part of Cusco province in the department of Cusco.

The partner Rosa continues with her business selling beauty products. She has spent years working in her business which is doing well thanks to the effort she puts in each day to her business. She continues selling her merchandise to her customers, such as friends, family and others who place orders. She continues selling lipsticks, creams and perfumes which means she can provide for her family.

The member is applying for a loan to buy colognes and other items. The other partners earn a living from selling punch, a carpentry business, a grocery store business and a restaurant business.

The partner is grateful to those, who through this option, are part of this dream. She agrees to comply with the re-payment of her loan within the established time frame.

The partner that appears in the attached photo asked permission to be late for the meeting due to work commitments.

loans.use: to buy colognes and other items.

loans.name: Novavie

texts.en:
Three years ago, Novavie started her business raising hogs and cooking dishes to sell. She started this business to help her husband, who is a driver, earn a living for their three children who are 2, 9, and 10 years old.

As she spends her earnings for her family, Novavie is asking for additional capital to buy more piglets, feed, and supplements to prevent diseases.

Through the loan, Novavie anticipates a better income out of her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, and supplements.

loans.name: Telesfora

texts.en:
Telesfora is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Telesfora is 42 years old, and one of her children is currently in school.

Telesfora has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Telesfora requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more variety of fish to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.
