Telesfora has been in this business for 12 years. Telesfora would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza works hard to support her family. Aiza is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years now.

Aiza requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Aiza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Annamae

texts.en:
Annamae is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more stock like noodles, soft drinks, candies, beer, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Annamae has been in this business for five years. Annamae earns additional income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Annamae has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock like noodles, soft drinks, candies, beer, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 35 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing 12,500 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jocelyn has been raising livestock for 7 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia works hard to support her family. Apolonia is married and has a business making native mats and broomsticks in the Philippines.

Apolonia requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

Apolonia has been in this business for 25 years now.

Apolonia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Arlene is 44 years old and has five children who are currently in school.

Arlene has a buy and sell corn business in the Philippines. she requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of corn to sell.

Arlene has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of corn to sell.

loans.name: Hendryk Iván

texts.es:
Hendryk es un joven de 31 años de edad, él vive en su casa junto a su esposa y su hijo de tres años de edad, su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar y a cuidar su bebé.

Hendryk se dedica a trabajar como empleado de una sucursal de electrodomésticos y muebles, el trabajo le sale bien pues está muy cerca de su casa y viaja en motocicleta, cuando es su hora de almuerzo va hasta su casa para estar con su familia, él lleva ya casi 10 años de ser empleado de esa sucursal y asegura que pronto recibirá un ascenso. 

Hendryk necesita el crédito para comprar productos de primera necesidad como papel higiénico, azúcar, café, aceite, golosinas, sodas etc para la tienda que tiene con su esposa.  


Los planes de Hendryk son tener una casa mas cómoda y mejor equipada, también él quiere que su hijo tenga una buena educación y se convierta en una persona de bien.
texts.en:
Hendryk is a 31 year old man. He lives in a house with his wife and their three year old son. His wife is a homemaker and takes care of their baby. Hendryk works in an appliance and furniture store. His work is going well, and it is close to his home so he is able to get to work on his motorcycle. At lunchtime, he goes home in order to be with his family.  He has worked in this store for almost 10 years and he is certain that he will be promoted soon.

Hendryk is seeking a loan to purchase basic goods such as: toilet paper, sugar, coffee, oil, snacks, soda, etc. for the store that he and his wife have. Hendryk plans to have a more comfortable home with more amenities. He also wants his son to have a good education and became a successful person.

loans.use: purchase basic goods such as: toilet paper, sugar, coffee, oil, sweets, soda, etc. for his store.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene runs a sari-sari (variety) store from Ormoc City, Leyte. She also sells food products like hot dogs, longaniza (sausages flavored with indigenous spices), and Spanish sausage.

Arlene is 44 years old and married and has two children. She has been in the business for four years now. This is the source of her income.

Arlene is asking to take a loan to buy beer, soft drinks, hot dogs, sausages, canned goods, noodles, soda and other beverages, soap and other toiletries, cooking oil, and condiments.

Arlene believes that a loan will help her improve her inventory, thus attracting more buyers to her store and increasing her sales.

loans.use: to buy beer, soft drinks, hot dogs, sausages, canned goods, noodles, soda and other beverages, soap and other toiletries, cooking oil, and condiments.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria never gets tired of tending to her business. Her sari-sari store (convenience store) is in Ormoc City, Leyte. She is making good sales in her business, and sufficiently supports the needs of her family.

She needs additional capital to restock her sari-sari store with bottled drinks and soft drinks, noodles, canned goods, coffee, milk and condiments.

Gloria longs to live an abundant life through her business.

loans.use: to buy bottled drinks and soft drinks, noodles, canned goods, coffee, milk and condiments

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a woman who is 39 years of age. She is the mother of five children who are mostly in school.

Glenda is a very hardworking woman with great desires to achieve. She is selling barbecue and she also raises hogs for an income.

For this reason, she is looking for additional capital to grow in her agriculture activities. She needs funds to buy feed to fatten her hogs and meat to barbecue during the evenings.

One of her goals is to help her children get ahead in their education so that they can be professionals and thus improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and meat for barbecue.

loans.name: Josephina

texts.en:
38-years-old Josephina lives in Ormoc City, Leyte. She is married and has four children, aged 3-14. Josephina earns a living from sales in her sari-sari store.

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks of assorted groceries and other consumable products, such as soft drinks, tooth paste, shampoo, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasoning, detergent powder. Josephina hopes to expand his sari-sari store business for her children’s benefit.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, tooth paste, shampoo, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasoning, detergent powder

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a married woman from Kananga, Leyte . She joined CEVI in order to access the programs and services of the organization.

She's requesting a loan to invest in her sari- sari store business. She will use it to buy canned food, bottled drinks and feed. This will further enhance her income and increase her sales.
Flora hopes to continue her business and to be able to save enough money for future use and school fees of her 19 year-old son.

loans.use: to buy canned food, bottled drinks and feed

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 59 years old and married with seven children.

Clarita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items, like canned goods, candies, snack foods, noodles, soft drinks, etc., to sell.

Clarita has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Clarita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items, like canned goods, candies, snack foods, noodles, soft drinks, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad works hard to support her family. Soledad is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Soledad requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Soledad has been in this business for seven years now.

Soledad would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Lenlyn

texts.en:
Lenlyn is 31 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from electronic mobile load retailing.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like shampoo, detergent, soap, candies, biscuits, coffee, noodles, etc. to sell in her store.

Lenlyn has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and aspires to save enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like shampoo, detergent, soap, candies, biscuits, coffee, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Clemencia

texts.es: Rosa tiene 27 años de edad, es de estado civil casada, su esposo es jornalero, tienen dos  hijos, Marco de 10 y  Sebastián de 9 años de edad, ellos estudian en una institución cerca de su hogar, ella se dedica a la venta de productos varios en su pequeña tienda, ella ya está en  este pequeño negocio mas de 5 años, Rosa solicita de este crédito para invertir y poder ampliar su tienda, y así podrá  ayudar con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en: Rosa is 27 years old. She is married and her husband is a day laborer. They have two children: Marco, 10 years old, and Sebastián, 9 years old. They are students at an institution near their home. She sells a variety of products in her small store. She has been at this small business for more than 5 years already. Rosa is asking for this loan to invest and to be able to expand her store, and in this way she will be able to help with the household expenses.

loans.use: to set up her store

loans.name: Rattanak

texts.en:
Rattanak is 21 years old and he is a nursing student in the fourth year at university in a city. He is from the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. His father is a civil servant and his mother is a teacher.

Due to the fact that he is short of finances, Rattanak would like to request a loan to pay his tuition fee from the fourth to five year. With this loan, he will be able to graduate successfully with a skill to build his future. For his dreams, Rattanak is going to open his own clinic to help others and he will be able to build a new proper house for his parent’s and if he has children he wants them to study to pursue bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition fee from the fourth to five year. He is studying Nursing

loans.name: Sandy 50097 Group

texts.en:
Samaher is the featured borrower of Sandy 50097 group. She joined with with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to make sure they can cover their needs and develop their livelihoods.

Samaher is a 41-year-old married mother of three children. She works in the embroidery business to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their children. She is well known in her region for her special talents in her domain and the special prices she requests. Samaher is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house to make it a healthier place for her children in the upcoming cold winter season. Samaher is the first on the left. Janaa is the lady sitting in the middle, and Dalal is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to renovate her house to make it a healthier place for her children in the winter season.

loans.name: Madres Unidas Group

texts.es: Este es el  grupo “MADRES UNIDAS” conformada por 05 socias trabajadoras. Este es el caso de EULALIA de 55 años de edad viuda. Ella se dedica a la venta de salchipapas (comida peruana) Desde hace 5 años que tiene dicho negocio gracias a su esfuerzo está mejorando su calidad de vida. Su mayor deseo es de poder ampliar su negocio. Solicito el crédito para la compra de papas salchichas y lechuga. El grupo “madres unidas” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite mejorar su calidad de vida. Eulalia es la segunda del lado izquierdo se encuentra de pie viste polo azul y chaleco beige.
texts.en:
This is the group "MADRES UNIDAS" ["UNITED MOTHERS”] consisting of 5 hardworking members. This is the case of the 55 years old widow EULALIA.  She sells salchipapas (a Peruvian food). She has had said business for five years and thanks to her efforts she is improving the quality of her life. Her main wish is to be able to grow her business. She is seeking the loan to purchased potatoes, sausages and lettuce. 

The group “madres unidas” is thankful to the people at KIVA for making this loan possible, as it allows them to improve their quality of life. Eulalia is the second one standing on the left side wearing a blue t-shirt and a beige vest.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, sausages and lettuce.

loans.name: Mirna Isabel

texts.es: Mirna de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijas, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mirna, aged 39, lives in a home she owns with her three daughters.

She has worked for several years making and selling tortillas. She runs her business from home, and has many customers. With her earnings she is able to pay some of the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn by the quintal and lime powder so that she can continue to make tortillas, and so gain a higher income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal and lime powder.

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en: Virgenia from Ormoc City is engaged in a business of selling rice from farmers in her area. This business started a year ago. She earns PHP4000 from this venture. This provides the basic needs of her four children, aged four to nineteen. She is asking for a loan to buy more rice to sell, thus improving her revenue. Virgenia hopes to have another source of income that will enable her to support her children’s higher education in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more rice

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a mother of four children. She is from Kananga, Leyte. She is 42 years old and is engaged in selling clothes, umbrellas, slippers, and toys.

Marife works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children.

As of now, Marife is in need of additional capital for the expansion of her business. She is asking for a loan to buy more products to sell such as toys, t-shirts, and slippers.

With this, she will be able to increase her stock and attract more customers and buyers into her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy toys, t-shirts, and slippers.

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina lives in a town called Kananga in Leyte, Philippines. She is with her spouse and two children, who are seven and twelve years old.

She is a rice retailer and she also sells beauty soaps to her friends and neighbors.

Marlina is asking a loan from CEVI to further invest in her rice retail business. She will use her loan to buy rice and sell it for a profit. This loan will enable her to improve her business, thus augmenting her income.

Out of her profit, Marlina focuses on her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy rice

loans.name: Feleciano

texts.en:
Feliciano fishes for a living in Ormoc, Leyte. Even with his fishing, he also works hard in finding other means to earn.

At the moment, he also has started selling fruits and vegetables in a small corner attached to his home and in the market.

Feliciano is asking for a loan to buy more fish from other fishermen and vegetables to sell. With this money, he will be able to increase his stock and improve his revenue.

In the future, Feliciano hopes to make his business bigger and more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more fish and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is a businesswoman  from Ormoc City, Leyte, Philippines. She is 55 years old, married, and has an 18-year-old son. Marina is engaged in retail sales of vegetables, eggs, canned goods, seasonings, fruits and condiments. Marina would like to improve her stocks. She is asking for a loan to buy seasonings, fruits, eggs, shampoo and detergent. In the future, Marina plans to offer additional merchandise to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy seasoning, fruits, eggs, shampoo and detergent

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Help Lita see a glimpse of a better future through your generosity today. With a dream to have a sustainable living and ensure that her children will complete schooling, she works very hard to help her husband support the family. Lita is currently involved in recycling of old rubber tires and interiors into plant pots and garbage containers. She earns while doing her share in the preservation of the environment in their community in Butuan City, Agusan Del Norte. 

She's really grateful that your previous financial assistance in the amount of PHP 15,000 which enabled her to buy volume of raw materials for her business. It went a long way and provided for the needs of her six children. She's also happy to inform you that she has faithfully repaid the loan. This couldn't be possible without your help, dear lenders. Thank you so much! 

This time, she's knocking at your kind hearts again. You may notice that the area where she is working has no roof. She suffers from heat of the sun and she stops working when it's raining. She longs to construct a roof so she can work without delay. A PHP 18,000 would be very helpful. She will also use part of the loan to buy the needed raw materials for her business. It's her wish to have a bigger workshop area someday.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy used rubber tires and interiors as raw materials for her business and a new roof

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 55 years old and married with three children.

Elvira is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Elvira requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Elvira has been raising pigs for nine years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Elvira would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 48 years old and married with 11 children. With four of her children currently in school, Letecia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, where she sells a variety of items such as snack foods, cooking oil, detergent, soap, shampoo, noodles, etc. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her business.

Letecia has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her business

loans.name: Jhona

texts.en:
Jhona is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jhona is 35 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Jhona has a candle making business in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials like wax, wicks, and other items for her business.

Jhona has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like wax, wicks, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 43 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a 29,500 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like noodles, spices, meat, fish, vegetables, and other items for her food production business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like noodles, spices, meat, fish, vegetables, and other items for her food production business.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a hard-working woman who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is married and owes the payment of school fees for her two children.

Margret operates a food stall, mainly selling the staple foods for people in her area. She supplements her income with cocoa farming. She has been in the food stall business for seven years and is happy with the progress because she is able to pay the school fees for her children.

Her biggest challenge is insufficient capital to buy stocks for her customers, given the fact that it is the Christmas season. Her dream is to buy land and expand her cocoa farming.

Margret is requesting a loan to buy foodstuffs to sell, like rice, cassava, and maize flour.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to sell, like rice, cassava, and maize flour.

loans.name: Eresi

texts.en: Eresi is aged 45 years, a married woman who labors a lot for the betterment oh her family. She has been in the business of operating a lockup selling cooked food and tea to her customers. She does cocoa farming, where she obtained start up capital to start her lock up business. She has a responsibility of paying school fees for her children, only to be challenged by lack of enough funds to fulfill all her plans of educating her children and stocking enough foods to use to cook for her customers. She thus requests a loan to buy foods like bananas, rice, beans and others to cook and sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy foods like bananas, rice, beans and others to cook and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is the age of 43, living in the rural area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is very hardworking and gentle person and owns a small restaurant in which he offers different types of delicious food, two times in a day. He has been running this restaurant for 6 years and earning good profit from restaurant business.

He offers tea to his customers also, now he wants to establish his restaurant by purchasing new plastic furniture. Due to household expenses his savings are not enough to buy desired things.
Therefore, Kousar requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy furniture.She thanks Kiva and appreciates the warmth of support for her.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her husband's restaurant

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a 30-year-old married woman who started almost two years ago working as a tutor from her house to help her husband in covering their needs and expenses. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who has a wide experience in the teaching domain, as she used to work as a teacher in a school.

Layla is very helpful and patient, as she considers teaching as a very humanitarian job. Today, she is planning to open her own educational center for students with special needs, thus she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary classroom supplies and educational tools (Alphabet Knowledge, Cognitive toys, language development, seating, etc..) specialized to students with special needs.

Layla hopes to succeed in her new business and achieve her dream.

loans.use: to open an educational center for students with special needs and buy classroom supplies and educational tools

loans.name: Jose Adonaldo

texts.es: José tiene 46 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 20 y 16 años de edad, en casa de su propiedad desde hace varios años. Él se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador que se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos y presta sus servicios de jornalero en una hacienda cercana, con lo que logra llevar el sustento a su familia. José desea reconstruir su vivienda, ya que actualmente está hecha de lámina deteriorada, por lo que buscando brindar mayor seguridad a su familia, solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lamina, madera, clavos y alambre para reconstruir su vivienda y proteger a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 46 years old and lives together with his wife and 2 children who are 20 and 16 years old.  For several years, he has been living in a house on his property. He describes himself as hardworking, selling dairy products and offering his services as a day laborer at a farm nearby, by which he succeeds in supporting his family.

José would like to rebuild his home, which currently consists of deteriorated metal sheets. In order to provide more security for his family, he is seeking a loan from FUSAI to buy metal sheets, wood, nails and wire to reconstruct his home and protect his family.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, wood, nails and wire to reconstruct his home and protect his family.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evelyn is 43 years old and has four children who are in school.

Evelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, vegetable, meat, spices, etc..

Evelyn has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, vegetable, meat, spices, etc.

loans.name: Sergio De Jesús

texts.es: Sergio es un experimentado carpintero del municipio de San Jacinto una tierra conocida por el legado artesanal de sus antepasados, quienes se caracterizaron por su laboriosidad e ingenio en la agricultura y las artes, especialmente, en el tejido de hamaca y derivados del algodón, también se producen productos elaborados en madera e instrumentos musicales y la ebanistería es una de las principales actividades del municipio. Sergio es un especialista en la elaboración de mecedoras, alcobas, juegos de comedor, puertas, ventanas y  cualquier tipo de mueble que le soliciten sus clientes. Él se capacitó en una institución del estado en el año 1987 donde logró adquirir las habilidades y competencias para llevar a cabo su labor con mucha calidad y perfección.  En su taller lleva 15 años de funcionamiento y cuenta con una clientela fidelizada.  En la actualidad realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar madera e insumos necesarios y realizar una producción de puertas y camas que exhibirá en su taller, de este modo incrementará la venta de productos terminados. Sergio es padre de dos hijos y su principal meta es lograr que accedan a la universidad.
texts.en:
Sergio is a skilled carpenter in the municipality of San Jacinto, a land known for its ancestors' crafts, who were known for their industriousness and ingenuity in agriculture and the arts, especially in the hammocks and other things made from cotton. They also make wooden products and musical instruments; woodwork is one of the main industries of the municipality.

Sergio is a specialist in the production of rocking chairs, bedrooms, dining sets, doors, windows, and any furniture that a customer might request. He was trained in a state institution in 1987, where he acquired the skills and abilities needed to accomplish his work to standards of high quality and perfection. Sergio has been operating his workshop for 15 years and has a loyal clientele.

Sergio is currently applying for a loan through Kiva and Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to buy timber and the supplies he needs to make doors and beds that will be displayed in his studio, thus increasing the sales of his products. Sergio is the father of two sons and his main goal is to get them access to college.

loans.use: to buy wood and materials needed to make doors and beds.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen, who deals in a fresh food stall, is a married woman with two children; they live in Bundibugyo, Uganda.

She has been in business for the last six years. She also does farming to get additional income.

Ellen loves her family very much and she does all it takes to provide them with the basic needs. She has some difficulty because of unpredictable weather changes that affect her crops and also competition from people dealing in similar businesses.

She is in need of a loan to buy more stock of fresh foods like bananas and onions, among other foods, to sell.

loans.use: to buy stock of fresh foods like bananas and onions, among other foods, to sell.

loans.name: Donesa

texts.en:
Donesa, from Ormoc City, Leyte, is 29 years old. She is a mother to three children who are attending school. Six years ago, Donesa started raising pigs for an income. It will take four months before she can sell her pigs.

She is asking for a loan to buy feed and supplements so that she can feed them enough to be healthy and to fatten them. Healthy pigs are more attractive to buyers and will allow Donesa to negotiate a higher price when selling.

Donesa dreams of always expanding her business, so that she can support her children's needs in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplements

loans.name: Policarpia

texts.en:
Policarpia is a piggery owner from Ormoc City in Leyte. She is 45 years old and has two children who are 12 years old. Policarpia decided to raise hogs recently, hoping that she can help her driver husband earn a living for their family.

She requested a loan to buy additional piglets and feed. Policarpia hopes to make her planned expansion possible with the help of the loan. In the future, she hopes to make her business more successful so that she can save up for and support her children’s higher education.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Sirlys Paola

texts.es: Sirlys es una emprendedora mujer de 27 años que está comprometida y es madre de dos hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, ella inició su negocio de venta de carne, pollo y cerdo en el año 2012, actividad en la que por años su familia se ha desempeñado con buenos resultados, así que ella opto por continuar con esta tradición.  Diariamente le suministra carnes a vecinos, conocidos y referidos los cuales son cancelados de contado.  Sirlys sueña con tener un negocio más grande que le genere mayores ingresos, por lo pronto trabaja con mucho compromiso y dedicación para lograr que las ventas que sobrepasen el punto de equilibrio y así obtenga ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. En la actualidad realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar pollo y carne, y mantener un stock que respalde sus solicitudes de pedido.  Sirlys continuará trabajando conforme lo ha hecho: comprometida y dedicada para cumplir con su meta de tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Sirlys is an enterprising, 27-year-old woman who is fully committed and the mother of two children, ages 5 and 3. She began her own business, selling meat, chicken and pork, back in 2012. Her family has been in this business for years with good results. Thus, she opted to continue in the family tradition. Each day she sells meat on a cash basis to neighbors, people she knows, and other customers who were referred to her.

Sirlys dreams of having a larger business that will generate greater income. For this reason, she works with much commitment and dedication to achieve sales that will surpass the point of equilibrium and, thus, obtain income to sustain her family.

At present, Sirlys is requesting a Kiva loan that will provide an opportunity to link her to the financing experience through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. Her intention is to purchase more chicken and other meats in order to maintain sufficient inventory to cover her customers' requests. Sirlys intends to continue working as she has, committed and dedicated, in order to achieve her goal of having her own house.

loans.use: purchase chicken and other meat to sell.

loans.name: Juan Eyver

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Eyver tiene 44 años es de profesión técnico de celulares trabaja como ayudante en una tienda hace más de 2 años realiza trabajos mantenimiento a celulares cambio de pantallas flhaseos, liberación de celulares cambio de software todo tipo relacionado con los equipos móviles hoy requiere del préstamo de dinero para poder emprender y abrir su propio taller ya que en este tiempo ha adquirido mucha experiencia el tema de celulares y él se siente capaz de poder trabajar solo e independizarse es por ello que necesita dinero para el equipamiento del taller que desea abrir el préstamo   invertirá en la compra de una vitrina  estantes computadora y herramientas necesarias para el buen desempeño de su trabajo el sr Juan es una persona amable trabajadora con ganas de superarse cada día comenta que ya tiene clientes quienes le animan a poner su propio negocio y así poder tener mejores ganancias y poder un nivel de vida mejor siendo el que administre su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Juan Eyver is aged 44, and is a mobile phone technician.

He has worked as an assistant in a shop for more than two years. He maintains mobile phones, replaces screens, unlocks mobiles, changes software, and everything related to mobile devices.

He now needs a loan to be able to launch and open his own workshop, as in this time he has gained much experience with mobile phones and feels able to work for himself and become independent.

This is why he needs money for the equipment for the workshop he wishes to open. This loan will be used to buy a display cabinet, shelves, a computer and necessary tools to ensure the success of his work.

Juan is a friendly, hardworking person who wishes to outdo himself every day. He says that he already has customers who are encouraging him to set up his own business, and thus have a higher income and a better quality of life, as he will be running his own business.

loans.use: to buy equipment for a mobile phone servicing workshop, in order to generate a higher income.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a cocoa farmer who also sells food, like cassava flour, fresh foods, like tomatoes, onions, and other items in the market. The need to cater to her family plus pay school fees for her children, forced her to engage in this business.

She complains of the bad roads used to buy her products from the suppliers that make transport costs high, on top of inadequate capital. Her family dream is to educate her children in higher institutions of learning.

The purpose of the loan is to buy fresh foods to sell, like tomatoes and onions. She is grateful to Kiva for the previous funds, which helped her to buy foodstuffs to sell, like tomatoes, and she managed to get some good profits.

loans.use: to buy fresh foodstuffs to sell to her customers, like tomatoes.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is an enterprising, humble man, who is a cocoa farmer and also owns a clinic in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been in the clinic business for two years now.

He was inspired to serve the people mainly because he looked at the long distances they travel to the government hospitals for free medical services, and in most cases, drugs are out of stock. Being a family man, he is charged with the responsibility of paying school fees for his children. His challenge is that customers usually don’t pay him on time, and yet he needs the money to restock the drugs.

Stephen will use the loan to buy drugs like paracetamol, aspirin, children’s syrups and others to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs like paracetamol, aspirin, children’s syrups and others to sell.

loans.name: Magadalena Ernestina

texts.es:
Magdalena es una señora emprendedora de 75 años de edad, a pesar de su avanzada edad ella es muy trabajadora y activa pues no hay nada que la detenga para salir adelante, vive junto a su hijo y nieta, ella es soltera pues a su hijo lo crió sola y con esfuerzo.  


Magdalena se dedica a la elaboración de quesadillas artesanales, sus quesadillas son las mas deliciosas de toda la ciudad, ella vende por encargos hasta 100 quesadillas y las personas incluso le hacen pedidos para enviar al extranjero a los amigos y familiares, ella se ha dedicado a eso por mas de 50 años, aprendió el oficio de su abuela y hasta el día de hoy su enseñanza le sirvió de mucho, además posee una farmacia que le genera buenos beneficios económicos, ella es un ejemplo claro de que la edad no es un obstáculo para superarse y lo ha demostrado en las actividades productivas que ella realiza.

Esta señora emprendedora necesita de mucha ayuda con este crédito para comprar ingredientes como queso fresco, leche, harina, levadura, crema, huevos, azúcar, etc. Para la elaboración de las quesadillas, ya que tiene un pedido muy grande para esta fechas de fin de año. 


Ella sueña con que Dios le permita seguir viviendo muchos años mas para disfrutar con su familia ya que piensa que la vida es bella y vale la pena vivirla.
texts.en:
Magdalena is an enterprising 75-year-old woman. Despite her advanced age, she is very hard-working and active since there is nothing that keeps her from moving forward. She lives with her son and granddaughter. She is single and raised her son alone and with effort.

Magdalena makes artisanal quesadillas. Her quesadillas are the most delicious in the whole city. She sells orders of up to 100 quesadillas and people even place orders to be sent abroad to friends and family members. She has done this for more than 50 years. She learned it from her grandmother and what she taught has been very useful to Magdalena up to the present day. She also has a pharmacy that generates good profits for her. She is a clear example that age is not an obstacle to improving yourself and she has demonstrated it in the productive activities that she does.

This enterprising woman needs a lot of help with this loan to buy ingredients such as fresh cheese, milk, flour, yeast, cream, eggs, sugar, etc. to make quesadillas, since she has a very big order for these end-of-year dates.

She dreams that God will let her keep on living many more years to enjoy her family, since she thinks that life is beautiful and it is worth living.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as fresh cheese, milk, flour, yeast, cream, eggs, sugar, etc. to make quesadillas

loans.name: Regie

texts.en:
Regie is a very hard-working woman who operates an auto repair shop. She repairs multicabs, motorcycles and other vehicles. Aside from that, she also runs a welding shop to earn supplemental income.

Regie is married and has two children, one still attending school. She lives in Mayorga, Leyte.

She has requested a loan to purchase materials like wrenches, screw drivers and a rubber mallet. These will improve the services she offers to her clients.

Her income will improve and she will be able to continue supporting the needs of her family.

In the future, Regie is hoping that both businesses will become successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase materials like wrenches, screw drivers and a rubber mallet.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn, 47 is an entrepreneurial mother who started her small business five years ago in Ormoc, Leyte. She sells pancit (noodles), pakbit (sautéed vegetables with shrimp paste), and adobo (a dish of chicken or pork stewed in vinegar, garlic, soy sauce, bay leaves, and peppercorns).

With the experience Marilyn has gained from running her business, she is now ready to expand and has asked for a loan from CEVI to buy ingredients like chicken, pork, soy sauce, cooking oil, noodles, vegetables, seasoning, and fish.

Marilyn has three children, who are going to school. With her new income, Marilyn will buy food for her family, pay school fees, and invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like chicken, pork, soy sauce, cooking oil, noodles, vegetables, seasoning, and fish.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, age 32, is a married woman with children. She has been in the business of cocoa farming for the last 10 years.

She supplements her income by growing food crops for both commercial and home consumption. She solely has the responsibilities of paying school fees for her children and providing for the family needs, being the only income earner. Her businesses are affected by unpredictable weather changes, especially the heavy rains and floods.

The purposes of the loan are to pay her child's fees balance and to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to pay her child's fees balance and to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Gladence

texts.en:
Gladence deals in cocoa buying and selling, which is the major economic activity done by people of Bundibugyo district.

Having been in business for five years now, Gladence boasts of the progress achieved because she has been able to pay school fess for her children and also provide her family with food and other necessities.

She supplements her income by selling rubber shoes which are worn by many people in her area. Her hardship is that the cocoa agents tend to buy from them at low prices and of course competition given the fact that many people deal in the similar business.

Gladence's dream is to have a stable source of income to be able to suit the current economic conditions in this developing country. Gladence intends to use the requested loan to buy rubber shoes, commonly known as baggagawale, to sell.

loans.use: to buy rubber shoes, commonly known as baggagawale, to sell.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
The purpose of the loan that Dinah is requesting is to buy shoes to sell. She has been in business for the last 10 years, buying and selling cocoa using the starting capital she got from her husband.

The two work hand in hand for the betterment of their family by paying children’s school fees, medical bills and the day to day needs.

Dinah supplements the family's income by selling a brand of shoes that many people like to wear because of its durability.

She faces a challenge of seasonal changes, especially heavy rains that make the cocoa drying difficult and cause price fluctuations of the product.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Rhodalene

texts.en:
Rhodalene runs a businesss selling vita plus products within her community. She is 35 years old, married and blessed with three children.

Rhodalene has been involved in the networking business for three years. She wishes to buy more stock of Vita Plus health drink products but lacks capital. She is seeking a loan of PHP 5,000.to buy more boxes of juice drinks to sell.

She hopes that through this loan, she could increase her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy Vita Plus health drinks and boxes of juice drinks to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine grows and sells rice. She is a 51-year old married mother of two children, one still attending school.

Her husband is a carpenter. They support each other to improve their livelihood.
She lives in the town of Sierra Bullones.

For the past two years,Josephine has been selling rice to the locals. She would like to enhance the yield of her farm to become stable.

Josephine has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer. She would be able to gain a bountiful harvest with fertilizer. She plans to save and continue to pursue other sources of income.

She dreams of having a small business that could be reliable to support her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 38 years of age, married, and blessed with three children. She grows a variety of vegetables to earn a living. She and her husband have been working hard to improve their living conditions, sustain their daily needs, and maintain their business involvement.

Dolores would like to buy vegetable seeds, pesticides and fertilizer, but she does not have enough capital. With regard to her situation, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000. This loan will enable her to nourish her vegetable crops and help them grow healthier and profitable.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, pesticides, and fertilizer for her vegetable farm land

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace hails from the town of Carmen. She owns a shop, selling souvenir items, like key chains and t-shirts. She is a 41-year-old, married woman and has three school-aged children.

She would like to expand her livelihood. She would like to acquire additional capital to purchase a variety of supplies.

Mary Grace would like to improve her source of livelihood to become more productive and improve the family’s living conditions.

She would like to buy additional supplies, like souvenir items and t-shirts. In that way, she would be able to continue to expand her business and become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies, like souvenir items and t-shirts.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila lives in the rural town of Sierra Bullones. She engages in hog raising as a livelihood. She raises and sells pigs to the local settlers in her area.

She is a fifty-one-year-old married woman, and has five children. Three of them are still attending school. Her income mainly goes for food and school expenses. She has requested a loan to buy a pig and pig feed. These are vital in her livelihood. She is capable of raising quality hogs. Slowly, her earnings will improve. She will be able to build her capital and continue to improve her livelihood.

Leonila is thankful for the funds, and is determined to manage them successfully to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a pig and pig feed.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is very hard working woman. She engages in food vending, selling snack foods like shakoy (twisted donuts), turon (sweet potato roll), and budbud (glutinous sticky rice). She is a 50-year-old married woman and has two grown children. Her husband earns a living by being a driver.

She has requested a loan to buy additional ingredients like flour, yeast, sugar, margarine, and edible oil. She could also produce a variety of snack food that she could offer to her respective clients. In that way, her finances will improve.

In the future, Luciana is hoping that she will become successful in her project to improve the family’s living conditions and also to finance the schooling of her children as well.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like flour, yeast, sugar, margarine, and edible oil.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. Lolita is married, and has a business making native mats in the Philippines.

Lolita requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business. Lolita has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Indatwa Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 40 years old and is married with five children, who are between 5 and 15 years old. He is well known in the business of selling a local drink. He has been doing this for about five years.

Emmanuel is the president of this group Indatwa, and this is his fourth cycle to request a loan from Vision Finance Company. He is a good client and pays his loans on time. He is the first person on the left side in the white shirt.

Emmanuel's hours of selling the local drink are from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. every day. He wants to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase a large quantity of sorghum to make the local drink for sale.

With the profit from this loan, Emmanuel will be able to purchase enough food for the family, buy new clothes for the children, pay school fees for his children, buy medical insurance for his family, and buy a motorcycle to help him in his business.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of sorghum to make a local drink for sale.

loans.name: An

texts.en:
Mrs An is 35 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for more than 10 years. An lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having latrine . She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

This is An first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, An hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman. She has 1 child. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open a big area for storing charcoal.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
For the past two years, Marilyn has been raising pigs as her livelihood. She raises the pigs and sells them to the local settlers in her place. She is a 46-year-old married woman and has two grown children.

She would like to improve upon the number of piglets she is about to raise, but unfortunately she does not have enough funds to support her livelihood.

Marilyn has requested a loan to purchase piglets and feed. These could help enhance her source of income and slowly enable her to settle her obligation.

She is thankful for the funds and is determined to manage the enterprise successfully for the improvement of her family's living condition.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Ma. Angie

texts.en:
Ma. Angie is 43 years old and married. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines.

Ma. Angie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ma. Angie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from farming rice.

Nenita is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers for her business.

Isabelita has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Isabelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 45 years old, and married with two children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines.

Lorena is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock. Lorena has been raising livestock for 10 years, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida works hard to support her family. Nida is widowed and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Nida requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

Nida has been in this business for four years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Nida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Luizia

texts.en: Luizia has been involved in retail activities since 2014. She started her business with her own working capital of $700. Luizia has a small kiosk, so she is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants use to buy additional supplies according to people like, including shampoo, soap, lighters, noodles, biscuits, sugar, slippers, cigarettes, candles, sardines, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell. She is happy because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she can build her business so big in the future and her income can be increased.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soap, lighters, noodles, biscuits, sugar, slippers, cigarettes, candles, sardines, soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a fruit and vegetable-selling business in the Philippines.

Susana requested a PHP 22,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional fruit and vegetables to sell.

Susana has been in this business for 15 years now and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Susana would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Parental Care Junior School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Godfrey. He is an Administrator of Parental Care School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Nyahuka in Bundibugyo with 500 students. Parental Care School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Parental Care School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Godfrey ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 28-years-old married woman, living with her husband and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a very hardworking and loves his family very much and he tries to make sure that his family does not have any needs left.

He is involved in manufacturing and selling furniture, such as single beds, tables, etc. He started this business from his young age, now he has grown old and weak.
Today, her husband has many regular customers and also takes orders from other cities. This business yields a good income for her husband, but her family's needs are increasing day by day and she needs more money to afford household expenses.

She wants to buy more raw materials for her husband for making furniture in order to expand the business. This is why she came to BRAC Pakistan and wishes to obtain a loan, so that her husband can buy raw materials for making furniture.

She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for his business as well as for his family.
Naseem thanks to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her husband's furniture making shop

loans.name: Kibingo School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Allen. She is the Head Teacher of Kibingo Girls School, a girl’s school in the urban area of Kibingo in Sheema with 1000 students.

Kibingo Girls School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. Kibingo Girls School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term.

Allen ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Ziba

texts.en: Ziba is 22 years old. She is living in Bilasuvar region with her family, and has just finished her education. She loves helping her family and she also supports her old parents such as visiting them daily and taking care of the farm. Ziba is a kind and also very caring, very hard-working person and loves her job as a farmer,  involved in daily farming activities. She has some cattle and raises small calves in her own yard. She usually fattens them and sell their meat in the local market. This activity she has been doing for the last two years, but has seen her parents doing it for more than 10 years and gained a vast experience. People in Azerbaijan prepare traditional foods mostly with meat. Since she knows that the existing demand is high in the local bazaar so she is also planning to expand the business a little. To meet the demand she needs to have calves to fatten and to buy few more cows. Currently she is planning to expand the farm. In order to expand her farming business, she requires to buy 2 more calves. For this she needs 1900 AZN. She hopes that Kiva lenders will show their support.

loans.use: to buy 2 more calves

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 50-year-old woman from the town of Trinidad in Bohol. She is married with three grown children.

Elizabeth has three small livelihoods which are her sources of income. She farms rice, sells home-cooked dishes and raises pigs. Since most of her business requires waiting time, Elizabeth is asking for a loan as additional capital. She will use it to buy fertilizer, piglets, pork and chicken for the dishes that she prepares.

Elizabeth's income will provide herself and her husband with the healthy diet that they need. Elizabeth also hopes that someday she can turn her business around and make it into a big restaurant that offers catering services.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, piglets, pork and chicken for dishes.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando is 46 years old, married with 2 children, and lives in Ozamiz City, Rolando grows and harvests rice as his family's main source of income to make a living. Farming takes a long period to earn income, and while waiting for the harvest, Rolando also earns income from his motor transport services. He earns well from this and was able to successfully repay his previous loan from GDMPC, which he used for motor repair. Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC to pay for his license permit to continue his transport services. He plans to use the additional revenue generated for buying organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to pay for his license permit to continue his transport services.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou hails from the town of Carmen, Bohol. She is a 25-year-old married woman and has one young dependent. She raises and sells hogs and works hard to support the needs of her family. Her husband's occupation is a laborer.

Marilou needs funds to support her existing project. She has requested a loan to buy feed and piglets. It could boost her income and help her continue to handle it properly. Thus, it could support her family and provide better living conditions.

Marilou is hoping that someday she will be productive in her chosen field.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be humble.

Mary operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more stocks of vegetables.

Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 44 years old and has six children. Mary Ann is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Mary Ann is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mary Ann has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Maximiana

texts.en:
Maximiana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a raising livestock business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Maximiana has been in this business for 15 years. Maximiana earns more income from food vending.

Maximiana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is 50 years old and married, with four children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. Gleceria requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Gleceria has been in pig-fattening for six years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Gleceria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina and her husband live in Ptghavan village in the Tavush region, where they are involved in an agribusiness. They cultivate onions, sunflowers, cherries, and cornus in rented arable land near their house.

Aiming to boost their agribusiness and develop it further, Angelina is asking for this loan to purchase 4 sows and start pig breeding. She also plans to purchase forage for feeding the pigs and cover land rental costs to be able to continue her cultivation work.

Angelina hopes to receive lender's support and develop her business in agriculture, so her family will own a big and profitable farm in the future.

loans.use: to pay for four sows and forage for feeding pigs, and to cover land rental costs to be able to continue cultivation work.

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en:
Jovia is a hardworking married woman who operates a lock up selling retail items in Bundibugyo, Uganda.

Having been in business for the last five years, Jovia is happy about her progress so far, which has enabled her to maintain her cocoa plantation and buy a cow for milk production.

She is all smiles for the reason of her children being in good schools. The problems affecting her business are price fluctuations and inflation. She dreams of buying a preservative machine to keep her products fresh.

She requests a loan to buy stock of sodas, sweets, soap, salt, and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy stock of sodas, sweets, soap, salt, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 41 years old and has five children. Tessie is widowed and has two children who are currently in school.

Tessie is in the agricultural business, farming banana in the Philippines. Tessie requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Tessie has been farming banana for 8 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Tessie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lay Eain Kone Village Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are the CBO members from Lay Eain Kone Village, named Mar, Htoo, Htwe, Hte and Zaw. This loan will help the remaining members of their previous group and an additional ten more new members totalling 31 customers. The previous loan helped them purchase ducks, repair their duck farms, and buy high-quality feeds such as dry prawns.

The upcoming loan will be used to purchase additional ducklings and high quality feeds. This will, as well, help the group pay for their children's education.

All the members are very grateful for all the generous support that they are getting from the Kiva community.

loans.use: to purchase ducklings and high-quality feeds.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es una señora de 41 años de edad, ella es casada y vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, tiene un muchacho de 18 años y una niña de 12 años de edad, ellos estudian en la escuela de su comunidad. 

Alejandra se dedica junto a su esposo a la venta y comercio de especies menores, ellos venden pollos y cerdos. Los pollos los crían y preparan para venderlos en el mercado municipal de su pueblo, ahí ella tiene un puesto donde vende los pollos ya preparados y su esposo se encarga de vender los cerditos que crían en su casa, él los engorda y los días miércoles los lleva al tianguis a venderlos. 

Alejandra necesita del crédito para comprar mas pollos para vender en esta temporada de diciembre, ella quiere aprovechar la temporada ya que se vende mucho.

Los planes de Alejandra son tener éxito con su negocio para así ella poder disfrutar de las fiestas navideñas junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a 41-year-old woman. She is married and lives with her spouse and two children. She has an 18-year-old boy and a 12-year-old girl. They are students at the school in their community.

Alejandra and her husband sell and trade in small animals. They sell chickens and pigs. They raise and prepare the chickens to sell them in their town's main market. There she has a stand where she sells the already-prepared chickens, and her spouse is in charge of selling the little pigs they raise at home. He fattens them and on Wednesdays he brings them to the livestock fair to sell.

Alejandra needs the loan in order to buy more chickens to sell in this December season. She wants to take advantage of the season because a lot is sold.

Alejandra's plans are to be successful with her business in order to be able to enjoy the Christmas festivities with her family.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to sell in this December season

loans.name: Marjure

texts.en:
Marjure hails from the town of Sagbayan. She is married and has five children. She earns a living by raising and selling hogs. Aside from selling hogs, she also engages in farming; she grows and sells rice.

She would like to boost her earnings by raising more quality hogs and by gaining a bountiful harvest. Slowly, she could be able to set aside enough savings to invest in other business opportunities.

Marjure has requested a loan to buy fertilizer and pig feed. In the future, she is looking forward to having a stable source of income. She extends her thanks for the support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pig feed

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 79 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 adult children.

Nenita is a retired public school teacher. At present, she is receiving her monthly pension. The couple also manage a parcel of rice land. She earns approximately PHP 15,000 each month. This amount is so helpful to support the family's needs. She has requested a loan to be used for the financial assistance of her grandson’s job placement fees as seaman.

Nenita has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. Nenita is enjoying the programs and services of the cooperative, particularly insurance and savings.

loans.use: to provide financial assistance for her grandson's job placement fees as seaman

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Christine Rose is 17 years old, she is standing at the right corner side of the picture while her mother helen is at the left side. Christine Rose is the second of three children in the family. Her mother, Helen, supports the family through her abaca-weaving business in the Philippines.

Christine Rose is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration and is currently in the first year of this four year program.

Helen is borrowing PHP 6,000 to pay for tuition fees for the year.

When she graduates, Christine Rose plans to be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana works hard to support her family. Luciana is married, and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Luciana requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store. Luciana has been in this business for 10 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Luciana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Florame

texts.en:
Florame is 36 years old and married with five children. With four children currently in school, Florame works very hard to provide for them.

Florame runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. Florame has been in this business for five years, and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, chocolate drinks, soft drinks, juice, coffee, sugar, detergent, etc.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. In the future, Florame would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 40 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Janet has a general store business in the Philippines. Janet requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Janet has been in this business for eight years.

Janet would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 48 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Rosita has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns an income from selling ready to wear clothes.

Rosita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur lives with his wife and two school-aged children in Zovaber village of the Gegharkunik region. Artur has a vocational education with a specialization in Accountancy. For a short period of time, he worked in his profession but then he started farming in which he has been engaged up 'til now. With his lovely wife, they take care of their farm cows, a heifer, sheep, lambs, pigs and chickens. Their plot of land is also good for different vegetable cultivars.

Artur is also good at various construction work so he decided to do some repairs to his house. Artur is asking for this loan of 690,000 AMD since he has some works to do in his bathroom and he also wants to change the old worn out wooden windows of his flat.

loans.use: to do some repair work in his bathroom and change the old wornd out wooden windows of his flat.

loans.name: Sreyleak's Group

texts.en: Sreyleak’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Sreyleak works as​​​ a doctor, and she also does extra work as a seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL ES UN PADRE DE FAMILIA QUE LABORA EN UNA EMPRESA DE MANOFACTURA PARA MANTENER A SU FAMILIA. ACTUALMENTE UNO DE SUS HIJOS ESTA PADECIENDO PROBLEMAS DENTALES Y REQUIERE DE UN TRATAMIENTO DE ENDODONCIA Y ORTODONCIA PARA CORREGIR LA ALINEACION DE SUS DIENTES, YA QUE EN SU ESCUELA ES MOTIVO DE BURLA POR SU DENTADURA. DESAFORTUNADAMENTE NO CUENTA CON LOS RECURSOS SUFICIENTE PARA SOLVENTAR LOS TRATAMIENTOS.
texts.en:
He is a family man who works for a manufacturing company in order to support his family. One of his children is suffering from dental problems and needs endodontic and orthodontic treatment to correctly align his teeth. He is teased about his teeth at school.

Unfortunately, he does not have enough resources to pay for the treatments.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is 42 years old and a married woman. She has been running a food stall business where she sells potato cutlass with bread. She is very enthusiastic in her work and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family.

Her husband also assists her in selling in the stall. She is a loving mother of six children. She is responsible for their food, health and clothing, and is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business.

For the improvement for her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase sacks of onions, potatoes and ginger along with stock of spices and oil to meet market demand consistently, which ultimately enables her to cover her utility bills timely.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of onions, potatoes and ginger along with stock of spices and oil

loans.name: Koudhi Group

texts.en:
Ladsamee is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan. Ladsamee and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.

The water filter Ladsamee and his group purchased is guaranteed for two years, but is known to function for up to five years. Ladsamee and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease.

After totaling up the costs, Ladsamee and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will provide for them and their families. The 7th person in the group was determined by TerraClear to not be visible enough for full recognition by Kiva in the group. The 7th person did receive a microfinance loan from TerraClear but this loan was not submitted for financing through Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en: Nisrine is a 38-year-old married mother of three. She started, fifteen years ago, working as an accountant to help her husband in satisfying their family' needs. Due to the limited income of Nisrine's family, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees. She hopes to stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions.
