loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Rejean

texts.en:
Rejean and her husband are engaged in a fishing business like most people in the community of Concepcion, Iloilo. They have been doing this for three years to earn a living.

Rejean is asking for a loan to buy fish traps known as “bobo” in order to enhance their catch.

She is a 34-year-old woman and a mother of four children aged 16, 14, 12 and 8 years old.

Rejean’s main goal in life is to be a successful individual. She wants to have better means of living, so as to give a good life to her children. In this way, she will be able to enhance their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fish traps known as "bobo."

loans.name: Fredelina

texts.en:
Fredelina hails from the town of Talibon. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells commodities like noodles, milk, sugar, seasonings, soap, shampoo, and assorted canned goods. She is a married woman and has five children, of whom three are still attending school.
Her sari-sari (variety) store is located in front of her house, serving neighbors and nearby residents. She has been running a sari-sari store for five years now.

Fredelina  would like to improve her business to become more productive and maintain the content of her store.
She would like to invest in soft drinks, canned goods, liquors, and rice. These are vital to gain income for her day-to-day livelihood, and to continue to expand her business for success.

With her previous loan, she was able to repay it back successfully, and now she is requesting a new loan to continue expand her current business and also to save for future investment.

loans.use: to invest in soft drinks, canned goods, liquors, and rice.

loans.name: Zaujiya

texts.en: Zaujiya is a single woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a married woman with three children. Margarita is 55 years old and two of her children are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Margarita has a business selling accessories in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business. Margarita has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future, Margarita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business

loans.name: Marietes

texts.en:
Mar Kevin is 22 years old and is the first of the three children in his family. His mother Marietes, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Mar Kevin is studying for Bachelor of Science in Nautical Studies and is currently on his 3rd year of this 4-year course.

Marietes is borrowing PHP 22,400 to pay tuition fees for the second semester of the school year 2015-16.

When he graduates, Mar Kevin plans be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her son.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Vivian works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store, dried fish and vegetable vending. Vivian is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, vegetables, rice, etc., for her food vending business.

Vivian has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, vegetables, rice, etc., for her food production business

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a married woman with six children. She is 48 years old and two of her children are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Mercedes has a rug making business in the Philippines. Mercedes requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials for her rug making business. She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Mercedes would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her rug making business

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion is 51 years old and married with eight children. With two of her children still in school, Presentacion works very hard to provide for them.

Presentacion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like soy sauce, cooking oil, canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as soy sauce, cooking oil, canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, etc.

In the future, Presentacion would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like soy sauce, cooking oil, canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Eye's Group

texts.en: Eye’s Group lives in a rural village in Kampot province in Cambodia. Eye makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as village coordinator to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman; she has four children, all of whom attend school. Jackline owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Jackline has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other operators in her business.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Universal College School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Charles. He is an administrator for Universal College School, a mixed school with 450 students in the rural area of Kisenkende in Mubende.

Universal College School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistently clean drinking water, and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children.

Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. Universal College School will repay the loan from the school fees, which it collects each term.

Charles ultimately hopes that access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Rina

texts.es: Doña Rina de 66 años de edad se dedica desde hace 7 años a la crianza de cerdos, comercializa los cerdos en los diferentes mercados, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, Doña Rina vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas cerdos y así poder continuar con la crianza de los mismo y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Rina is 66 years old and has worked for 7 years raising pigs and selling them in different markets. With the income from her sales she has been able to get ahead with her household expenses. Rina lives in her own home with her life partner. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy more pigs and thus be able to continue raising them and have more income.

loans.use: to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Osney María

texts.es: Osney es una esteticista de 53 años de edad que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación emprendió su propio negocio en el año 1998, ella es madre de tres hijas y vive con su cónyuge en un barrio de la ciudad de Cartagena en donde ofrece sus servicios de belleza.  Estudió en una corporación estética y belleza, y al poco tiempo de haberse graduado empezó a ejercer su labor, inicialmente solo prestaba servicios a domicilio, pero con el fruto de su trabajo logró ahorrar para comprar equipos y adecuar su local.  Hoy en día recibe a sus clientes a partir de las 4 p.m. en jornada continua hasta las 11 p.m. para realizarles, exfoliaciones, depilaciones, masajes, terapias de rehabilitación y otros tipos de tratamientos de belleza.  Osney realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar productos para realizar sus servicios entre ellos cremas exfoliantes, humectantes, aceites y demás.  Su meta a futuro es comprar su propio local y su casa propia.
texts.en: Osney is a 53-year-old esthetician, who started her own business in 1998 with great effort and dedication. She is the mother of three daughters and lives with her partner in a neighborhood in the city of Cartagena, where she provides her beauty services. She studied in a school of esthetics and beauty, and soon after graduation began working. At first she only provided services from home, but with her earnings she was able to save up and buy equipment to adapt her business premises. She now sees customers from 4 pm until 11 pm to provide them with exfoliations, hair removal, massages, rehabilitative therapies and other types of beauty treatments. Osney is requesting a Kiva loan as an opportunity to be connected to financing through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. With the loan she will buy products to provide her beauty services including creams, exfoliants, moisturizers, oils and other things. Her future goal is to buy her own business premises and her own home.

loans.use: to buy products to provide her beauty services including creams, exfoliants, moisturizers, oils and other things.

loans.name: Ruqayyah Islamic School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Abubakar. He is the head teacher of Ruqayyah Islamic School, a mixed school with 300 students in the rural area of Iganga.

Ruqayyah Islamic School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistently clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children.

Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. Ruqayyah Islamic School will repay the loan from the school fees, which it collects each term.

Abubakar ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Campo Ernesto

texts.es: Campo es de estado civil soltero, tiene 65 años de edad, el se dedica a la producción y venta de leche, el ya lleva en esta dura actividad más de 30 años, el solicita del crédito para comprar una vaca de leche para aumentar la producción, y así mejorar su calidad de vida y satisfacer sus necesidades diarias.
texts.en: Campo's marital status is single. He is 65 years old. He makes a living producing and selling milk. He has been in this tough occupation for more than 30 years. Campo is requesting the loan to buy a milking cow to increase the production and thus improve his quality of life and meet his daily needs.

loans.use: for the purchase of a milking cow.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, which serves as the family's main source of income. He sells merchandise like cooking oil, cold drinks, seasonings, coffee, powdered milk, pouch vinegar, soap, shampoo, eggs, and toiletries. He is married, and has one dependent. He resides in the town of Loon.

He would like acquire additional capital to fill his store with what is out of stock. Unfortunately, at this time, he has insufficient funds to do bulk purchases.

Jorge wants to purchase stock like beverages, soft drinks, liquors and condiments. That is vital, and will improve his daily earnings. In that way, he will be able to invest other sources of income, and be able to pay his obligations.

He is grateful to Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to purchase stock like beverages, soft drinks, liquors and condiments.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda has been an entrepreneur for 10 years already. She’s grateful that the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) was able to quickly respond to her loan request. The amount that they approved enabled her to buy sacks of raw corn for her business. She wants to thank as well all of the lenders who provided financial support without asking for anything in return.

Nilda wants to continuously support her family, and that’s why she’s hardworking and determined to make the business grow. Her goal, like that of other entrepreneurs, is to attract more patrons for the increase of the business’ revenue. Regular supplies of corn is what she wants to maintain, and an approximate amount of PHP 30,000 is what she needs. That’s why she applied a loan of that amount once again.

Nilda is consistent in attending a weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members, where she gains spiritual strength from members' life changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans and hears God’s word, that is conveyed to members every week.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of raw corn for her business.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is able to run her business without getting worried about how to get funds for the business. The previous loan amount of PHP 12,000 was used properly. She bought sacks of cloth remnants for her rug-making business. She wants to thank lenders for helping her financially and the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for the loan approval.

She’s able to help her husband with the house expenses, that’s why she’s thankful to God for giving her this as one of their sources of income. She dreams of investing in a house someday and saving money for future purposes. But for now, she’ll focus on how to earn more by making the business grow. She applied for a loan of PHP 10,000 and this amount will be used to buy sacks of cloth remnants, threads and other necessities for the business.

Joy regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and experience in the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and to listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy sacks of cloth remnants, threads and other necessities for her rug-making business.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.en:
Sebastian is a cocoa farmer who also earns a salary from the town council in Kasese, Uganda. He is a hardworking and experienced farmer who has been in business for 12 years. Sebastian, however, faces a challenge of weather change, which affects the productivity on his farm.

At the moment, cocoa is at its weeding stage, requiring him to pay for labor to those working there. He is then requesting money to pay for labor to weed, and to buy fertilizers for his cocoa garden so that he gets better quality cocoa and will be able to compete on the world market.

loans.use: to pay for labor to weed, and to buy fertilizers for his cocoa garden.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La señora Ana estudió hasta el noveno grado, está casada y tiene tres hijos los cuales dos de ellos viven con ella y estudian mientras que su esposo trabaja como empleado.
 

Ana se dedica a la venta de cosméticos,  ella decidió un día trabajar con un negocio propio ya que veía que los ingresos del esposo no eran suficientes para el sostén del hogar, entonces tomó la iniciativa de vender cosméticos, ella sale 3 veces por semana casa por casa en su comunidad y aledaños para vender los productos.
  
Ella solicita este crédito para comprar pintalabios, rubores, esmaltes, lociones, etc. para continuar con su negocio de venta de cosméticos.


El sueño de la señora Ana es con ver triunfar a sus hijos que lleguen a ser unos excelentes profesionales y sentirse orgullosa  de ellos,  así mismo con algún día tener un local propio con su negocio ya instalado.
texts.en:
Ana went to school as far as the ninth grade. She is married and has three children, two of whom live with her and attend school while her husband works as an employee.

Ana works selling cosmetics. She decided one day to start her own business when she saw that her husband's income was not enough to support their household. She thus took the initiative to sell cosmetics. She goes out 3 times a week from door to door in her community and neighboring communities to sell her products.

She is requesting a loan to buy lipstick, blush, nail polish, lotions, etc. to continue with her cosmetics sales business. Ana's dream it to see her children succeed at being excellent professionals and to feel proud of them. She would also like to have her own business premises one day.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, blush, nail polish, lotions, etc. to continue with her cosmetics sales business.

loans.name: St. Charles Lwanga High School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Benedict. He is an administrator at St. Charles Lwanga High School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Kasubi in Kampala with 500 students.

St. Charles Lwanga High School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and currently spends a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children.

The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. Installing a water filtration system will save the school money in the long-term.

St. Charles Lwanga High School will repay its loan from school fees, collected each term.

Benedict ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system for school.

loans.name: Hadame's Group

texts.fr:
Crée le 28 Décembre 2011, le banc villageois est composé de femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles sont très dynamiques, elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenu du petit commerce à l’agriculture. Il existe une bonne entente entre les membres du groupe.

Madame Hadame (assise à gauche en 3ème position avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Mariée, âgée de 55 ans et mère de 05 enfants dont 1 fille et 4 garçons. Elle s’active dans la vente de la patte d’arachide, et du mil,  Elle  s’approvisionne au marché hebdomadaire de sare Alkaly et de Touba Mouride. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

Elle désire acheter 20 sacs de 50kg de mil, et de l’arachide 10 sacs de 50kg.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la gestion du foyer, des soins médicaux et frais de scolarité d’une part et d’autre part accroitre son épargne.
texts.en:
Created on the 28th of December 2011, the banc villageois is made up of women who all live in the same village. They are very dynamic, they carry out diverse revenue-generating activities from petty trade to agriculture. There are good relations between the group members.

Mrs Hadame (seated third from the left with a hand raised) is the group's featured borrower. She is married, 55 years old and the mother of five children of which one girl and four boys. She works selling groundnut paste and millet. She gets her supplies at the weekly market in Sare Alkaly and Touba Mouride. She has a good experience in this field.

She wishes to purchase 20 50-kg bags of millet and 10 50-kg bags of groundnuts. The profits will allow her to support her husband in the household management, medical care and school fees on the one hand and to grow her savings on the other hand.

loans.use: to buy 20 50-kg bags of millet and 10 50-kg bags of groundnuts.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita raises hogs to covered the needs and expenses on their household. She is 51-year old married woman and has three children, whom one is still attending school.

She has sold hogs to the locals in her place. She has face challenges in her livelihood, like the liquidity of capital to expand and secondly, the high cost of livestock supplies.

Carmelita needs funds to support her existing project. That is why she has requested a loan from CEVI to invest in piglets and feed. It could boost her income and able to raise quality hogs. Thus, support her family and provide better living condition.

She is hoping that someday, she will be productive in her chosen field.

loans.use: to invest in piglets and feed

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
The first few years of managing the business became very challenging for Antonia. However, because of Kiva's program, she was given a chance to avail credit loans to recover. She’s thankful that people were willing to help new entrepreneurs like her. She was able to buy stocks of phone accessories to add to her business.

Antonia's previous loan of Php 25, 000 was granted and made a vast impact on the business. Because of the increasing demand for the products she sells, she needs to buy more stocks such as batteries, phone cases made from plastic, leather and fabric and screen protectors.

That’s why Antonia applied for a loan of Php 30, 000 loan through the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and lenders. The spare amount will be put in her savings account for the education of her children and for future needs.

Antonia believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony , share her own experience of God’s love, pay micro finance loans and hear God’s word that was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone peripherals to sell.

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita has had a variety store business for five years and she’s blessed that the business is still operating.

With the help of the Lord, Charlita is able to sustain the educational expenses of her children which is her goal as a mother.

To attract more patrons, Charlita is requesting a loan amount of Php 50,000 to complete all of the grocery items needed at her variety store business.

With the prior loan of Php 20, 000 Charlita bought grocery items for her variety store. The profit made a vast impact and she’s very thankful.

Charlita is grateful that Center for Community Transformation (CCT) was used by God to help her business. Aside on monetary support, lectures and seminars are part of their program, which is molding her continuously to be well equipped as an entrepreneur.

Despite of being busy managing the business, Charlita spares time attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hear testimonies from other CCT partners and able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to add grocery items to her variety store business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
There’s progress in Gloria’s business, as the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) was able to approve her previous loan, that eabled her to buy added grocery items for her variety store. Complete items on display will attract more patrons. That’s why she wants to send her sincerest gratitude to CCT and all of the lenders for their untiring support for every entrepreneur having financial capability to run a business.

Gloria is blessed by having the business, as she’s able to support the needs of her children. Good health for her and the whole family is what she continually prays for, and for her children to graduate from college and become professionals in the future.

She believes that an amount of PHP 30,000 will boost the business’ revenue, and that’s why she applied for that amount as a loan. She’s hoping that lenders and CCT will consider her story once again. The amount will be used as added to capital to buy additional grocery items for her variety store business.

Despite being busy managing the business, Gloria spares time for attending a CCT group fellowship that consist of 10 to 15 individuals, where she can gain strength spiritually, and where she hears testimonies from other CCT partners and is able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items for her variety store business.

loans.name: Dilcia Lorena

texts.es:
Dilcia  es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual desde muy pequeña le inculcaron que el trabajo es lo primordial, ella está casada y vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos los cuales los tres estudian y su esposo trabaja como motorista.
 

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, cosméticos y también joyería, ella ha sido y es una persona muy sociable que conoce a muchas personas personas que hoy en día son sus clientes, también vende antojitos en su casa ya que todo el negocio lo posee en la casa y está al servicio todo el día para sus clientes.
  
Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa para comprar camisas, blusas, pantalones, faldas, vestidos, ropa interior, etc. para vender en la época navideña.

El sueño de Dilcia es tener un bazar, también con que sus hijos sigan estudiando y lleguen a ser grandes personas de bien en un futuro.
texts.en:
Dilcia is a very hardworking woman, who was taught that work is essential since she was very little. She is married and lives with her husband and their three children who are all in school, and her husband works as a vehicle driver.

She earns a living selling clothes, cosmetics and jewelry. She has been, and is, a very friendly person that knows a lot of people; people that today are her customers. She also sells snacks in her home since she maintains her business at her home and she is serving her customers all day.

She is requesting a loan to buy clothes; to buy shirts, blouses, pants, skirts, dresses, underwear, etc. to sell during the Christmas season. Dilcia's dream is to have a variety store, and also that her children keep studying and become great people in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes; to buy shirts, blouses, pants, skirts, dresses, underwear, etc. to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
The above client is a new borrower to UGAFODE Nakasero Branch, He is single and is a boda boda cyclist [motorcycle taxi], he came to UGAFODE for a loan of ugx2,000,000/= purposely for setting up another business in order to diversify his source of income. But is facing a challenge of limited capital to finance the business being reason he is applying for a loan of UGX2000000 million shillings so that he can top up on buying another motorcycle that will be used as a motor taxi to raise income. Hillary is happy with support from kiva and Ugafode and he looks forward to repay well after he has gotten the loan. 
Hillary and the UGAFODE staff appear in the picture(left to right).

loans.use: Top up on buying a motorcycle

loans.name: Bubandi Seed S. School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Cleophas. He is the head teacher of Bubandi Seed School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Namugajju in Bundibugyo with 250 students.

Bubandi Seed School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children.

Installing a water filtration system will save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Bubandi Seed School will repay their loan with school fees collected each term. Cleophas ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system for his school.

loans.name: Marie Alen

texts.en:
Marie Alen has a variety store business where she sells grocery items by the piece, weight or volume.

Marie Alen is a hardworking mother who is 47 years old, She is raising two children; one in high school and the other in elementary and a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT).

Marie Alen also owns a house for rent. She has been an entrepreneur for 17 years and earns about Php 16,000 every month.

Like any other entrepreneurs, Marie Alen wants her businesses to flourish and continually support her family.

She submitted necessary documentations for her loan application of Php 15, 000 to buy grocery items for her variety store business. Marie Alen believes that this will be the start of her business’ growth if granted.

On a weekly basis, Marie Alen regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to add grocery items to her variety store business.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is from Pasay City, Philippines. She was only 21 years old when she started her buy and sell business. Jovelyn sells ready-to-wear clothes near the area where she resides.

Being a young entrepreneur was very challenging to Jovelyn since she also has three children to raise, as she wants to provide their daily needs. Her husband is Jamail who works as a sales assistant.

As a fruit of her labor, she wants to invest for something valuable. It could be furniture, equipment or anything that will benefit her family. Indeed, being on a young age is not a hindrance if you want success to take place.

Jovelyn applied for a loan amount of Php 15, 000 to buy necessities for the business. She’s preparing for this coming holiday season as wants to stock more designs with different sizes of clothes.

She is hoping that CCT would grant her request since this loan will be a great help for her business’ growth.

Jovelyn is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony , share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and hear God’s word that was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothes for her business.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 60 years old and married with three children.

Felomina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like beverages, condiments, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Felomina has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

In the Future, She want to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like beverages, condiments, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz tiene 57 años de edad, es de estado civil soltero, ella se dedica al comercio de chanchos, ella es una persona tranquila y muy responsable con su trabajo, ya que a esta actividad que se dedica más de 20 años se ha vuelto una gran fuente de trabajo, gracias a este negocio ella ha podido salir adelante  con los gastos de su hogar, solicita el crédito para poder invertir en mas chanchos, para poder aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Luz is 57 years old, and is single. She earns a living selling pigs. She is a calm person, and she is very responsible with her work. Since she has over 20 years of experience in this occupation, it has turned into a great source of work.

Thanks to this business she has been able to move forward with her home expenses. She is requesting a loan to be able to purchase more pigs in order to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy pigs to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa con 35 años de edad,de estado civil casada,vive en casa propia,junto a su esposo y sus hijos, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, con una experiencia en el rubro hace más de 02 años aproximadamente. Adicionalmente a la venta de alfalfa. Solicita préstamo para la compra de 01 mototaxi. De esta manera obtendrá mayores ventas y atención a sus clientes y así poder generar mayores ingresos para una mejora en la calidad de vida de él y la de su familia.

Rosa cuenta con experiencia crediticia en Edpyme Alternativa, con pagos puntuales.
texts.en:
Rosa, 35 years old, is married and lives in her own house with her husband and children in the Cayaltí district in the province of Chiclayo, department of Lambayeque and country of Peru. She has very good personal and work references from inhabitants in the area. The residents in this area make a living mainly through agriculture, trade and cattle raising.  

Rosa makes a living raising and selling farm animals, with experience in the market starting approximately two years ago. Additionally, she sells alfalfa. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle. This way, she will obtain more sales and improve service with her customers – and therefore earn a greater income to improve the quality of life for her and her family. 

She has lending experience with Edpyme Alternativa with on-time payments.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor de María con 47 años de edad,de estado civil separada, vive junto a sus dos hijas, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado y mariscos, con una experiencia en el rubro hace 05 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de materiales para realizar arreglos en su local, y así poder ofrecer mejor comodidad para sus clientes.De esta manera le facilitará seguir trabajando y obtener sus propios ingresos.

Flor de María cuenta con experiencia crediticia, es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Flor de María who is 47 years of age and is in a state of civil separation, lives together with her two daughters in the district of Cayaltí in the province of Chiclayo, of the Lambayeque region in Perú. She has many good references, both professional and personal, from the inhabitants of the area. The majority of the inhabitants of this locality make a living from agriculture, commerce and livestock farming. 

She makes a living from the sale of fish and seafood, with 5 years of experience in the field. She requests a loan to buy inventory for her shop and to be able to offer her clients a greater variety. In this way, it will enable her to keep working and gain her own income. 

Flor de María has credit experience, and is an ongoing member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her shop

loans.name: Noelina

texts.es:
Noelina con 34 años de edad, de estado civil madre soltera, vive en casa familiar,junto a su hijo, en el distrito de Nueva Arica,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza,con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 05 años,su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo,compra de cerveza por motivo de que llega la fiesta de Nueva Arica esto con la finalidad de poder incrementar su negocio y así poder dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Noelina es socia recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Noelina, 34 years old, is a single mother, and lives in her family house with her son, in the Nueva Arica district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department, Peru. She has very good personal as well as work references. The inhabitants of this town work mostly in agriculture, business, and livestock.  

She works in the sale of beer, with experience in this trade since she was 5, her business is located in her home. She is looking for a loan for working capital, to buy beer because the festival of Nueva Arica is upcoming and she wants to be able to increase her business, and so she is able to give better service to her customers.  

Noelina is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: For working capital, to buy beer because the Nueva Arica festival is upcoming

loans.name: Jany

texts.es:
Jany con 31 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material de adobe,junto a su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos, en el distrito de Copallin,provincia de Bagua,departamento de Amazonas,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1 hectárea de variedad Catimor resistente a enfermedades, plantación está en su tres años de producción tiene 4 años de edad, con una experiencia en el rubro hace 08 años. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo y venta de cacao. El destino del crédito será para invertir en el mantenimiento y cultivo de 1 hectárea de café en fase de abonamiento, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2016, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Jany es socia nueva para Edpyme Alternativa. Firma con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Jany is 31 years old, is in a civil union, and lives in her own home made of adobe. He lives with her partner and two young children in the Copallin district, in the Bagua province, in the Amazonas department of Perú. He has very good personal and professional references from the citizens in the area. The people in this area work mainly in agriculture, business and livestock farming.

He works in agriculture, specifically in coffee farming. To date he has 1 hectare of the Catimor variety, which is resistant to disease. The plantation is in its third year of production and is four years old. He has 8 years of experience in this field. Additionally, he works in growing and selling cacao.

The loan will be used to invest in the maintenance and farming of the 1 hectare of coffee which is in the fertilizing stage, making sure they will have a good harvest in the 2016 season, which will be reflected in a greater volume of sales. The result will be a greater income so that he can improve her quality of life and that of his family. Jany is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa. He is signing with her partner.

loans.use: to invest in maintaining and farming a one hectare coffee farm which is at the fertilizing stage.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is a 50 years old entrepreneur who just opened a variety store and e-loading business, in 2013.

He applied for a loan of Php 10, 000. The amount will be used to add grocery items for his variety store as he dreams to succeed in the industry.

Rodrigo’s grateful because the businesses enables him to earn income daily. He’s working hard to continually support his children’s educational expenses; one in elementary and the other attends college.

A variety store is known as “sari-sari” store in the Philippines where you can buy cheap items. Basically, most sari-sari stores can be found in every Barangays, municipality and even in cities. Whilst, an e-loading business tops up mobile phones.

Rodrigo is grateful for the support Center for Community Transformation (CCT) offers not just on monetary but also on seminars and lectures they provided for aspiring entrepreneurs.



Rodrigo regularly meets with his co-fellowship members to share his life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to add grocery items to his variety store business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen’s previous loan application became a medium for her to step up her business. The amount granted by Center for Community Transformation (CCT) was used as supplementary funds. She wants to send her sincerest gratitude to all the lenders and CCT for the monetary provision they’ve provided.

Helen is focused on how to grow her business as she aims to transfer to a bigger location to attract more patrons. Aside from the income earned by her husband Julian, this business selling grilled seafood has become their source of income and support for their children’s school expenses. She dreams as a parent for her children to finish college and be professionals someday.

Helen aspires to have savings for her future needs and for her family. She applied for a loan amount of PHP 30, 000 and she has faith that CCT will once again grant her loan application. She will use it for buying more quantities of seafood. Since Christmas is now approaching, she’s preparing for made-to-order of the products that she sells.

Helen is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and hear God’s word that was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to purchase fish, charcoal, and ingredients for grilling.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a fishing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Mary Jean dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eight children.

She earns a living by fishing in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and gasoline for her fishing boat. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Erlinda dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment and gasoline for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Sol Natalie

texts.en:
Sol Natalie is 37 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Sol Natalie has a frozen food retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more frozen foods to resell. She has been in this business for two years. In the future,

Sol Natalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to resell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eight children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines, and is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and seedlings for her vegetable farm. She supplements this income with earnings from her passenger tricycle business.

Jocelyn dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en:
Jeralyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Jeralyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

In the future, Jeralyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es una mujer de 30 años de edad que inicio un negocio de venta de productos de la canasta familiar persiguiendo un sueño de comprar una vivienda propia.
Ella vive en unión libre con su pareja, tiene dos hijos de 13 y 10 años de edad, los cuales representa su mayor preocupación.
Su negocio nació de la necesidad económica, no podía salir a buscar trabajo ya que tiene que cuidar a sus niños y la tienda a representado un enorme apoyo en términos económicos para su familia.
Con el firme propósito de mejorar sus ventas y tener un completo surtido para la temporada de fin de año la señora Lucia solicita un préstamo para la compra de víveres, abarrotes, verduras y lácteos.
texts.en:
Lucia is a 30-year-old woman who started a business selling staple goods in pursuit of the dream of buying her own house.

She is in a common-law marriage with her partner. She has two children aged 10 and 13, who are her greatest concern.

Her business was born of economic necessity. She could not go out to look for work, since she has to take care of her children, and the store has been an enormous support in terms of support for her family.

With the firm goal of improving her sales and being completely stocked for the year-end season, Lucia is asking for a loan to buy food, groceries, vegetables, and milk products.

loans.use: to buy stock for the year-end season

loans.name: Kabwohe Mothercare  School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Freedom, the director of Kabwohe Mothercare School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Kabwohe in Sheema with 600 students.

Kabwohe Mothercare School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system, with a 450 litre tank, to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children.

Installing a water filtration system will save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced.

Kabwohe Mothercare School will repay their loan from school fees, which it collects each term.

Freedom hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system for a school.

loans.name: Las Vecinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Vecinas está en su ciclo número 12 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, trabajan dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Vidalina quien se dedica a la venta de bebidas variadas, comenta que ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella, y que le es de  mucha ayuda su negocio para dar a su familia una vida digna.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas de todo tipo para poder tener una mejor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes,  y de esa forma seguir ayudando a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group called Las Vecinas (The Neighbors) is in its 12th cycle in the women's committee program, where all of them work and help each other to get ahead. They work within the poverty elimination program, fighting to improve their living conditions.

One of the members is Vidalina who works selling an assortment of drinks. She mentions that she already has a good clientele that always buys from her, and her business is very helpful in giving her family a respectable life.

She asks for this loan to invest in buying drinks of all kinds to be able to have a better variety to offer her customers, and in that way continue helping her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente con 40 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su cónyuge y sus seis hijos, en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura, comercio ya ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 2 hectáreas en producción de 3-4 y 5 años de edad de la variedad Catimor, plantación resistente a enfermedades y plagas,con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 3 años. Adicionalmente se dedicado a la cría-engorde de ganado vacuno,así mismo a la cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, menestras, vitucas y otros productos de la zona. El destino del crédito será para asumir gastos de mantenimiento de parcela agrícola de 2 hectáreas de café de 3-4 y 5 años de edad, plantación se encuentra en fase de espigas florales, asegurando campaña 2016 con una mejor y mayor producción reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtener mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Vicente es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. El firmará con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Vicente, 40, in a common-law marriage, lives in his own house of rustic materials, together with his spouse and their six children, in the district of Santo Tomas, province of Cutervo, Cajamarca, Peru. He has very good references, both work and personal, among area residents. The people of this town are mostly engaged in agriculture, livestock breeding, and trade.

He works in agriculture, specifically the cultivation of coffee, and to date has 2 hectares in production of 3-4 and 5 years old of the Catimor variety, in a planting resistant to diseases and pests, with 3 years’ experience in this line of work. Additionally he has worked in cattle-breeding and fattening, and in the breeding of small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, and others) and the cultivation of staple foods (yucca, legumes, taro, and other products from the area).

The loan will cover maintenance expenses for a 2-hectare [almost 5 acres] agricultural parcel of coffee of 3-4 and 5 years old. The planting is in the floral spike stage, assuring the 2016 season with better and increased production reflected in a larger volume of sales. Vicente will therefore earn more income so as to thus be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.
Vicente is a recurrent member of Edpyme Alternativa. He will sign the loan with his spouse.

loans.use: cover maintenance expenses for a 2-hectare [close to 5 acres] agricultural parcel of coffee.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 24 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marissa has a business buying and selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. She requested a 9,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock of purified drinking water to sell.

Marissa has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 52 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Nelly has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of goods to sell.

Nelly has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.en:
Dorotea is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dorotea is 40 years old and both children are in school.

Dorotea has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of rice to sell.

Dorotea has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: José Ángel

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 61 años de edad, es una persona la cual tiene pocos estudios pero muchos conocimientos, él es soltero y vive solo en su casa que con mucho trabajo ha logrado construir.
 
José es una persona muy trabajadora, posee una granja de gallinas ponedoras el cual es su fuente de ingreso principal, con el tiempo él ha experimentado de todo, criar cerdos, vacas y algunos animales más, también trabaja en la agricultura todos los años la cual es otro ingreso extra para mantenerse.
  
Él solicita este crédito para comprar concentrado para las gallinas y vitaminas para darles un buen cuido, y así le generen buena producción de huevos.

El sueño de José es con seguir trabajando con lo que más ama ya que trabajar con las aves es su gran pasión también sueña con algún día encontrar a alguien con quien compartir su vida.
texts.en:
Señor José is 61 years old and is a person who, although he has studied little, has much knowledge. He is single and lives alone in his house that, with much work, he has managed to build. 

José is a very hardworking person, and has a chicken farm of laying hens that is his main source of income. Over time, he has experienced everything, raising pigs, cows and other animals, as well as always working in agriculture to have another source of income to take care of himself.

He has applied for this loan to buy concentrate for his hens and vitamins to take good care of them, as well as to generate good egg production.

José's dream is to continue working with what he loves most: working with his hens, his greatest passion. He also dreams of someday finding someone with whom to share his life.

loans.use: to buy concentrate for his hens and vitamins to care for them.

loans.name: Yeferson Saul

texts.es:
Yeferson es un joven de 20 años de edad que se encuentra solicitando tu apoyo para comprar una máquina recubridora, el inició con un negocio de confección en el año 2012, ya que le gusta generar recursos, paga su educación y ayuda a su madre, es un joven muy capaz, aplicado, responsable y agradecido con su familia.

Yeferson se dedica a al confección a terceros, la máquina le ayuda a entregar prendas más pulidas y así aumentar la satisfacción de sus clientes, igualmente le permitiría realizar confecciones propias o arreglar prendas, para él es una ventaja tener este tipo de maquinaria, principalmente porque puede obtener buenas recomendaciones y aumentar su volumen de trabajo.
texts.en:
Yeferson is a 20 year old who is requesting your support to purchase a sewing machine. He started a manufacturing business in 2012, since he likes to generate resources, pay for his studies and help his mother. He is a very competent young man, applied, responsible and grateful to his family.

Yeferson is dedicated the craft of sewing for 3rd parties. The machine will help him deliver more polished garments and increase the satisfaction of his clients. Equally it will permit him to do his own sewing or repair clothing. For him, it is a window of opportunity to own this type of machine. Principally it will allow him to get better recommendations and increase his volume of work.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, in order to improve his production time

loans.name: Jilmer

texts.es:
Jilmer con 35 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos, en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de café, de variedad Catimor, realiza esta actividad en terreno propio, con una experiencia en el rubro de 09 años. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, cerdo) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, plátano, vituca) para su consumo y en ocasiones para la venta y además trabaja como peón agrícola.El destino del crédito será para el mantenimiento y cultivo de 1 hectárea de café en producción, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2016, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar calidad de vida de él y de su familia.

Jilmer es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. El firma con cónyuge. .
texts.en:
Jilmer, 35, lives in his own home made of rustic material with his wife and his two young children. He lives in Peru, in the district of Santo Tomás, province of Cutervo, and department of Cajamarca. He has very good personal and professional references from the residents of the area. The people of this town work mainly in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

Jilmer earns a living in agriculture, specifically growing Catimor coffee. He does this on his own land and has nine years of experience. He also raises small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, pigs) and growing staple products (yuca, plantains, tubers) for his own consumption and occasionally to sell. Sometimes he also works as a day laborer.

The loan is to maintain and grow one hectare of coffee, which will ensure a good crop for the 2016 season. He'll have a greater volume of sales and, as a result, earn more income to improve his and his family's quality of life.

Jilmer is a returning member for Edpyme Alternativa. His wife also signed the loan.

.

loans.use: to maintain and grow one hectare of coffee

loans.name: Sonia  Amparo

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer soltera de 52 años de edad que se dedica a realizar esa bellas prendas que se pueden ver en la foto, adornos, billeteras, bolsos, entre otros, los cuales realiza artesanalmente, ella se encuentra buscando un apoyo económico para abastecerse de insumos como lo son cuero sintético, telas, hilos, botonería, entre otros, los cuales serán usados para producir bolsos y adornos navideños en grandes cantidades.
Ella es madre de dos hijos y son sus manos y su habilidad lo que le han permitido generar los ingresos para que su familia nunca pase necesidades.
texts.en:
Sonia is an unmarried 52-year-old woman who earns her living making beautiful clothes that you can see in the photo, in addition to ornaments, wallets, purses, and other things that she makes by hand. She is seeking financial support to stock up on materials such as synthetic leather, fabric, thread, buttons, and others, which she will use to create Christmas gift bags and Christmas decorations in large quantities.

She is the mother of two children and her handiwork is what enabled her to generate income to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making Christmas gift bags and handmade Christmas decorations

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La socia Verónica es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, ella se dedica a vender distintos productos comestibles en el mercado según temporada. Gracias a esta actividad saca delante a su familia.

La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGENCITA DEL CARMEN DE HUYCHO”, tiene 24  años de edad, su sueño de la socia es  progresar.
Verónica solicito el préstamo para comprar azúcar y harina, productos que le ayudan a fabricar sus alimentos.

La socia esta agradecida con los inversionista de KIVA , ya que le ayudaran a conseguir sus metas, ella se compromete a pagar su cuotas en el plazo debido
texts.en: Verónica is an entrepreneurial and hard-working woman. She works selling different food products in the market according to the season. Thanks to this job, she supports her family. She belongs to the "Virgencita del Carmen de Huycho" communal bank. She is 24-years old and her dream is to progress. Verónica is asking for the loan to buy sugar and flour, products that help her to make her foods. She is thankful for the Kiva investors because they help her to achieve her goals. She promises to pay her dues in the allotted time.

loans.use: to buy sugar and flour.

loans.name: Las Chambitas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS CHAMBITAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Irashy, es una joven trabajadora que se dedica  al negocio de venta de productos de belleza. Ella es promotora y vendedora, ya hace muchos  años que se dedica a este negocio, sus deseos de salir adelante es lo que le impulsa  trabajar a diario.
La socia desea tener un local propio donde expender sus productos de belleza, por eso solicito el préstamo para poder tener mas mercadería.
La socia necesita comprar perfumen  colonias y cremas de belleza.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.
Los socios están contentos y agradecen a los inversionista de KIVA por el crédito.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Las Chambitas". This bank is situated in the Cusco district, part of the Cusco province and the department of Cusco.

Irashy is one of these members, she is a young, hardworking woman who has a business selling beauty products. She is responsible for promoting and sales, and has been involved with this business for several years. Her desires to get ahead is what inspires to work every day.

Irashy wishes to have her own premises from which to sell her beauty products, which is why she is requesting a loan for more goods. She needs to buy perfumes, cologne and beauty creams.

The other members sell handicrafts, clothing, groceries and books.

The members are happy, and grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, colognes and beauty creams.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from e-loading (selling prepaid mobile phone credits).

Evelyn is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of rice to sell.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es:
El Sr. Jose tiene 35 años tiene 3 hijos vive con su conviviente en la Provincia de los Rios en el Canton Ventanas.

Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra y cosecha de Maiz.

Don Jose manifiesta que el credito adquirido va hacer invertido en la compra de insumos y seguir trabajando.

El tiempo libre se dedica a realizar deporte.
texts.en:
José is 35 years old. He has three children and lives with his partner in the Los Ríos Province in the Ventanas Canton. He works in agriculture, planting and harvesting corn. José says that the loan acquired will be invested in the purchase of supplies and keep working.

In his free time, he does sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his corn growing operation

loans.name: Grupo Sector Las Milpas Group

texts.es:
Felipe (él segundo de derecha a izquierda) es un hombre de 63 años de edad, es soltero con una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 17 y 25 años de edad, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Desde hace 40 años Felipe trabaja como jornalero, realizando todo tipo de actividad en su comunidad, él es un padre de familia digno de admirarse porque a pesar de su avanzada edad busca aun la superación de su familia.
La siembra de milpa ya se está acercando  por lo tanto el necesita de sus semillas y fertilizantes aunque el en estos momentos carezca de dinero, está solicitando un préstamo con el afán de cubrir esta necesidad que tiene y poder cultivar a tiempo. Su esperanza de vida es incrementar su cultivo, fortalecer su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Felipe (second in from the right), is 63 years old. He is single, with a beautiful family of two children, ages 17 and 25. This humble family lives in a community in Sololá.

Felipe has been working as a day laborer for 40 years, doing all kinds of work in his community. He is a father worthy of admiration, because in spite of his advanced age, he still strives for the success of his family.

The time for sowing corn is already approaching, so he needs his seed and fertilizer, although he lacks money at the moment. He is requesting a loan in an effort to meet this need and be able to plant on time.

His life's hopes are to increase his crop, strengthen his business, and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Vanessa Katherine

texts.es:
La Sra. Vanessa tiene 27 años es de edad Estado Civil Soltera tiene 2 hijos vive en la Provincia de los Rios en el Canton Ventanas, se dedica a la venta al ppor menor de ropa interior para niño, niña y adultos de toda talla, el dinero lo solicita para la compra de mercaderia como son medias para ninos y ropa interior de adulto que es lo que mas se vende para ampliar el negocios por epoca de navidad.


los sueños de la Sra. es compra un terreno propio. el tiempo libre lo dedica a ver television.
texts.en:
Vanessa, 27, is single and has two children.  She lives in Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.

She earns a living in the wholesale of underwear for boys, girls, and adults of all sizes. She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise like socks for children and adult underwear, which she sells the most of and will help her to amplify her business in the holiday season.

Her dream is to buy her own plot of land.  She spends her free time watching television.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business like socks for children and adult underwear

loans.name: Henry Josué

texts.es:
Henry es joven muy luchador de 22 años de edad al cual le enseñaron que para lograr las cosas que quiere en la vida hay que trabajar muy duro, él vive con su esposa la cual es una joven muy trabajadora al igual que él, ella trabaja junto a su esposo en el negocio que poseen, están a la espera de su primogénito el cual esperan con muchas ansias.
 

Henry es una persona con ganas de trabajar, él posee un negocio en el mercado central de la ciudad donde vive, su negocio consiste en la venta de accesorios telefónicos como carcasas, baterías, protectores etc. Y también hace reparaciones de celulares, anteriormente trabajaba en un negocio similar que era de un amigo ahí fue donde aprendió todo lo que hoy en día conoce acerca de lo teléfonos celulares, con él trabaja su esposa la cual le ayuda en todo lo que puede, el local lo abren todos los días desde muy temprano y cierran hasta las 5 de la tarde, posteriormente retornan a su casa, la cual está a unos 5 minutos y se van en bus.

Él necesita un préstamo para comprar más repuestos para celulares, carcasas, baterías, protectores, cargadores, etc. Y así poder ofrecer un mejor servicio.

Él espera prosperar en su negocio, ya que están esperando a si primer hijo junto a su esposa y sabe que debe trabajar duro para que no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Henry is 22 years old, and is a young man who was taught that to achieve things that you want in life you have to struggle and work very hard. He lives with his wife, who is as hard-working as he is. She works together with her husband in their business, and they are awaiting their first-born child with much excitement.

Henry has a great desire to work. He has a business in the central market of the city where he lives, where he sells telephone accessories such as cases, batteries, protectors, etc. He also repairs cell phones. He previously worked in a similar business owned by a friend, where he learned all that he now knows about cell phones. His wife works with him, helping him with everything that she can. The business is open every day for very early until 5 in the afternoon.
They then return home, which is 5 minutes away by bus.

He needs a loan to buy parts for cell phones, cases, batteries, protectors, chargers, etc., so that he can provide better service. He hopes to prosper in his business, as he is expecting his first child with his wife, and he knows that he must work hard so that the child will not lack for anything.

loans.use: to buy parts for cell phones, cases, batteries, protectors, chargers, etc., so that he can provide better service.

loans.name: Mujeres De Trinidad Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres de trinidad  está trabajando de manera unida, donde todas a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo van mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las emprendedoras es la Sra. Leonidas quien tiene una despensa surtida todo tipo de productos, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, que pese a los problemas diarios está pudiendo crecer y mejorar. Pide este préstamo ya que quiere comprar verduras, frutas, carne, panificados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, a través del esfuerzo en conjunto.
texts.en: The group called Women of Trinidad is working together, so that all of them are improving  their living conditions through effort and work. One of the entrepreneurs is Leonidas, who has a store stocked with all kinds of products. She is a very hard-working woman who struggles to succeed, so that in the face of day-to-day problems she is able to grow and improve. She is requesting this loan because she wants to buy vegetables, fruit, meat, bread and other things in order to continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to improve her living conditions through effort and along with her group.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her business such as vegetables, fruit. meat, bread and other things.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a 61-year-old widow from Ormoc City, Leyte, Philippines. For more than five years, she has earned a living through her sari-sari (convenience) store business, selling various goods to the people in her area. She also sell fruits like bananas, and barbecue.

Elsa is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell such as meat, charcoal, seasoning, and condiments.

This loan will enable her to improve her sales, thus giving her a better life. In the future, Elsa hopes to make her business productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy meat, charcoal, seasoning, and condiments.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 51 years old and married with ten children.

Nenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 60,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nenita has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Nenita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Analia

texts.en:
Analia is 38 years old and married with two children.

Analia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries and vegetables to sell in her store.

Analia has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Analia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries and vegetables to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells commodities such as edible oil, eggs, noodles, milk, sugar, seasonings, soap, shampoo, and assorted canned goods. She is a married woman and has two young children.

For the past three years, she has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store, serving neighbors and nearby residents. Rosalyn would like to improve the inventory of merchandise to attract more customers. She would like to raise hogs as supplemental income. As of this time, she has insufficient funds to support her undertakings.

She wants to to purchase assorted groceries and also piglets. That is a very essential tool that would help improve her financial gain. Thus, she would be able to continue to roll out her capital and support the needs of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase assorted groceries and also piglets.

loans.name: Ainurkul

texts.ru: Айнуркул, 45 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей. Она ведет собственное хозяйство в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, стартовав 7 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Айнуркул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 коров, 12 овец и лошадь. На 2,50 Га земли она выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 19,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнуркул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений для полеводства, обработки почвы и выращивания экологически чистой фасоли, также на приобретение одной коровы. Доходы от кредита Айнуркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Ainurkul is 45, married, and the mother of two children.  She has been running her own farming business for the past seven years, and this activity constitutes her family's main source of income.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has six cows, 12 sheep and one horse on her farm.  She also grows beans for resale on 2.5 hectares of land.  She makes a monthly income of about 19,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her farming business, Ainurkul has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 55,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizers to prepare her soil and grow organic beans.  She will also use part of her loan to buy one cow.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further expand her activity.

loans.use: to buy one cow as well as fertilizers to prepare her soil and grow organic beans.

loans.name: Liliana Paola

texts.es: Liliana es una ama de casa de 29 años que encontró la oportunidad de poner su sazón a disposición de centenares de personas que transitan por las populares calles de un barrio del  municipio de Cartagena, ella es madre de dos hijos menores de edad que se encuentran bajo su cuidado y vive con su cónyuge en una humilde vivienda de esta localidad.  Diariamente ofrece desayunos típicos y almuerzos corrientes, sin embargo su oferta no se limita exclusivamente a lo que preparan sus manos, sino que también comercializa yogurt y prendas de vestir.  Ella desea a futuro tener la oportunidad de adecuar un local en su vivienda y formalizar su negocio, por lo pronto sigue en su labor muy comprometida y entusiasta, es por ello que realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar sillas y mesas, víveres para sus comidas, botellas de yogurt y ropa para la temporada navideña.  Liliana es una emprendedora mujer que con esta financiación logrará beneficiar a su familia y crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Liliana is a 29-year-old housewife who found the opportunity to make her cooking available to the hundreds of people who pass through the busy streets of a neighborhood in the municipality of Cartagena. She is the mother of two young children who are under her care and she lives with her spouse in a humble house in this place. She offers daily typical breakfasts and lunches with a set menu; nevertheless, her offerings are not limited exclusively to what her hands prepare, since she also sells yogurt and clothing. In the future she wants to have the opportunity to put a shop in her house and set up her business. For now she continues with her very committed and enthusiastic work.
